textList.name: NOTHING_SLUG
textList.text: You arrive at the beacon and are relieved at the sight of open space. Nebulas are terribly claustrophobic.
This beacon marks a 'small' gap in the nebula. No colonies or ships in scanning distance.
You are relieved to see your sensors blink back on after the jump. No ships detected.
The Slugs rely heavily on their telepathic powers and are reluctant to give up that advantage by extending beyond nebulas. It's unlikely you'll encounter any this far from the clouds.
You arrive in an area clear of nebula and quickly check to see if the sensors are working. Everything is fine and no ships are detected in the vicinity.

textList.name: NEBULA_NOTHING_SLUG
textList.text: When it comes to Slugs, no news is not necessarily good news. However, if they are watching, they don't seem to want to confront you.
It's not unusual to feel paranoia in a Slug controlled nebula, but for once, it is unfounded.
Either this part of Slug space is deserted, or it's too dense for even Slugs to detect your presence. Time to move.
This area of the nebula seems entirely empty until a small Slug transport and its escorts emerges suddenly from through the clouds, only to disappear again in a matter of seconds.

You explore around the beacon and are shocked when a rock the size of a small moon suddenly looms ahead of you. Scans reveal the solid-looking rock is just a husk, almost entirely mined out of useful minerals.

There are a number of small stations for travellers in the area, lit up by guiding lights and advertisements. Only Slug ships are docked so you decide it's better to avoid a confrontation and steer clear.

textList.name: NEBULA_STORE_SLUG
textList.text: A huge Slug teleports from nowhere onto the bridge! Before you can open fire, he's spread his wares across the helm and is brandishing things at you.

You cautiously approach a Slug colony on a huge asteroid. It's a brave person who sets foot on a Slug planet - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

event.name: SLUG_FIGHT
event.text: It's rare for the Slugs to stay exposed in open space for long periods - the ship here may be lost, or just passing through, but either way he moves in to attack!

event.name: SLUG_MANTIS
event.text: You intercept comm chatter from an incoming Mantis ship. "Look. This ship appears not to be owned by the squishy ones. Maybe they won't smell so bad when we cut them open." They move in on your position.

textList.name: SLUG_PIRATE
textList.text: There appears to be a pirate ship nearby. Be on your guard; anyone trying to hunt in Slug territory is either formidable or deeply stupid, and in space, either can be dangerous.
"We knew anyone foolish enough to try and sneak through a Slug nebula would stick to open space. Yield your goods and we may let you live." You cut the transmission in lieu of a response.
Before you can take a moment's rest from the ever present nebulas in this sector, a pirate ship appears behind you and opens fire.

textList.name: SLUG_REBEL
textList.text: As you arrive at the beacon, a hostile ship immediately registers on your scanners. You didn't expect to see Rebels extending their reach into Slug territory. Charge the weapons!
You jump into empty space and are relieved to see your sensors blink back to life. However, you are less pleased to see them immediately register a rebel ship on an approach vector!
You receive a message from a nearby ship, "Looks like our intelligence was correct! Sneaking through the clouds with the Slugs... No one can hide from the rebellion!"

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_CHOOSE_DEATH
event.text: You are immediately hailed by a dangerous looking ship guarding a station. "I'm feeling generouss today. I shall allow you to choose your own death. Which do you like leasst: shields, oxygen, or weaponsss?"
"Very good then!" Your shield power suddenly drops and they charge.
"A being that would choose sssuffocation? Who am I to judge..." Your life support is sabatoged and they move in to attack.
"Your acceptance of death is almosst admirable... Almosst." Your weapons system registers a hacking module. You hardly have time to respond before they attack.

choice.text: Offer 35 scrap to leave you alone.

event.text: "I really am feeling generousss..." They take the scrap and leave.
"Sssilence won't protect you. I'll make the choice mysself... Wait. Why isn't this working?" You cut transmission and move in to attack.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_HULLFIX
event.text: You arrive to find a small Slug repair station. "Greetingsss traveller! Care for a fix up? We could eassily patch up ssome of that damage."
"Too bad! Trussst iss a rare commodity these days." You prepare to jump.

choice.text: Ask if they would like payment.

event.text: You pull up to the automatic station and after a short time they repair 10 hull damage. You begin to offer your thanks but discover that you can't detach from the station.
You dock with the station hoping for a quick turnaround, but the automatic machines take their sweet time. When the process finally finishes, you notice only one damage has been repaired.

As you dock with the station your readings go haywire. An EMP blast resonates throughout the ship and your engines shut down. You're a sitting duck as a ship reveals itself and silently moves in to attack!
"We're glad you have enjoyed our servicessss. Perhaps some fuel would be an appropriate compensssation?"

choice.text: Give them the 15 fuel they demand.

event.text: You transfer the fuel and they release your ship. "Tell your friendsss about us!" Their portable station slips into the clouds.
"I'm ssssorry to hear that." He presses a button and an explosion rocks the ship. They must have planted a bomb while 'repairing'! Prepare for a fight!
"We're glad you have enjoyed our servicessss. Now for payment. To enssssure your cooperation we've taken the liberty of installing a limiter on your weapons system."

choice.text: Give them the 50 scrap they demand.

event.text: You transfer the scrap and they release your ship. "Tell your friendsss about us!" Their portable station slips into the clouds.

You activate your thrusters and force your way away from the station. A ship quickly moves in to engage. You'll need to get out of here fast; there may not be time to get the weapons fully operational!
"Ahhh. A fellow businessman. We offer to fix 10 damage for 50 ssscrap."
You perform the transaction and watch carefully as their machines patch the hull. However, everything seems fine. Once they're complete you get ready to jump.
"Too bad. Farewell, traveller." Their mobile station slips into the clouds.
Just before the transmission is cut you hear, "They're not falling for it. Just kill the crew and we can ssstrip..." Looks like you're not getting out of here without a fight.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_FAKE_STORE
event.text: A Slug transport ship is stationed near the beacon with a military escort ship. They message you, "We have been waiting for a customer for agesss. Care to see our waresss?"
"Oh well... We ssshall wait here then." You cautiously put distance between your ships before preparing to jump.
"Before we get ahead of ourssselves, I need to explain sssome ground ruless of our transsaction. Thesse are dangerous times, yess?"
"Firssst... We accept no tradesss, couponss or refundss. Purchasess are final. Underssstand?"
"We hold no liability for productsss damaged post ssale. We offer no insurance or customer sservice. Not a problem?"
"Fine... Not everyone appreciates good dealss..."

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Our Slug senses someone aboard the ship. Investigate it.

event.text: It looks like the merchant was trying to stall you while someone teleported on board. You catch him before he could finish and he teleports away. You immediately prepare for battle.
"Great. Let me show you our waress. It's not often I meet patient alienss, have this complimentary fuel as well."

"During our discussion, my man hass taken the liberty of disabling your weaponss to prevent any complications while completing our... transssaction..." You suddenly register multiple weapon locks, but your own weapons are not responding. Get out of there!
"Thank you. If you could do me one more courtesssy... please die quietly." You suddenly hear gunshots aboard the ship. He must have been stalling for time while they boarded your ship!
"Very well... Impatient alienss..." You prepare to jump.

You prepare to leave but notice noises in your ship. It looks like the merchant was trying to stall you while they hacked into your systems. You barely have time to order a red alert before a military ship flies through the clouds intent on your destruction!

textList.name: NEBULA_SLUG_FIGHT
textList.text: Your sensors are no match for the Slug's telepathic abilities - a ship you never even saw opens fire from astern!
The Slug vessel you encounter here has obviously made a big score and is looking to test its new armaments. They picked the wrong ship to attack.
A Slug passenger ship hails: "Please, your worthy alien highnessesss, we are unarmed and sseeking asssylum." You approach cautiously, and weapons immediately spring from their hull!
A Slug ship - a rogue, you suspect - approaches, but when he sees you're Federation he thinks better of the sneak attack and fires everything he has.
Direct attacks are not preferred by the Slugs, but of the three you see at this beacon, one has the brass to make a move on your position!
Your sensors are no match for the Slug's telepathic abilities - a ship you never even saw opens fire from astern!
The Slug vessel you encounter here has obviously made a big score and is looking to test its new armaments. They picked the wrong ship to attack.
A Slug passenger ship hails: "Please, your worthy alien highnessesss, we are unarmed and sseeking asssylum." You approach cautiously, and weapons immediately spring from their hull!
A Slug ship - a rogue, you suspect - approaches, but when he sees you're Federation he thinks better of the sneak attack and fires everything he has.
Direct attacks are not preferred by the Slugs, but of the three you see at this beacon, one has the brass to make a move on your position!

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_MANTIS
event.text: The Mantis attack ship here looks to have been hunting Slugs on their home turf - a rare test of honor for the mightiest Mantis crews. Weapons up!

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_PIRATE
event.text: You're surprised to find a ship without Slug markings stranded all the way out here, and move in to provide assistance. When you see the pirate insignia on the hull you quickly reconsider.

choice.text: Keep your distance and hope they haven't seen you yet.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DOORS
event.text: There are few more vicious beasts in the galaxy than a Slug with his back to the wall. The faltering ship armed with fire-weapons uses a remote hacking tool to try and disable your door system - they're going to burn you out!
Your hacking system automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_OXYGEN
event.text: The Slugs here use a tactic you hoped you'd never see: they use a remote hacking satellite to sabotage your oxygen production system and then charge fire-weapons - you're going to suffocate!

choice.text: (Improved Oxygen) Try to squeeze some extra power to the system.

event.text: Thankfully your improved subsystem is able to counter their hacking enough to keep the life support barely functional. That should keep you alive at least...
Your hacking system automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_MEDBAY
event.text: A Slug ship hails you: "We've detected some worrying radiation coming from your medical unit, perhaps you should take a look?" As he signs off, your system shuts off and their crew teleports aboard from a nearby station. They don't look like engineers.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Try to squeeze some extra power to the system.

event.text: Fearing the imminent battle you desperately try to get the medbay working again. Its lights flicker back on and you turn to face the intruders.
You are able to undo the damage of their remote hacking satellite but it's taking everything your hacking system has. Time to take out the enemy the old fashioned way.

textList.name: STORM_SLUG_FIGHT
textList.text: The ion storm here threatens to deactivate your core systems, a fact made all the worse for the largely unaffected Slug ships circling like space-vultures.
The Slug ship that descends into view as you enter the ion storm must have sensed your distress - defensive action!
You arrive in the middle of an ion storm. Slugs generally avoid these storms but you find one waiting in ambush. Prepare for a fight!

You find yourself stuck in the middle of an ion storm with a Slug ship just a short distance away, refusing all hails. You cautiously try to slip further into the clouds, but they turn suddenly to attack!

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DISTRESS_ROCK
event.text: You arrive to find a Slug ship in the middle of boarding a disabled Rock freighter.
You charge weapons and the Slugs immediately back down. When you return to the freighter, the Rockmen have already repaired the worst of their damage and jump away without another word.
You charge weapons and the Slugs quickly change course to meet your charge.
You charge weapons and the Slugs quickly change course to meet your charge.
You have no desire to provoke Slugs in their own territory. You leave them alone.
You have no desire to provoke the Slugs in their own territory. You leave them alone.

After the Slugs board the ship, you are surprised to see the Rock ship spring to life and decimate the other ship. They message you, "Pathetic. You are either a coward or an ally of the Slugs. Either way, you don't deserve to live."
It appears that the Rock ship left during your battle. You doubt they could have been more ungrateful for your assistance.
After the battle the Rock ship hails you. Their captain simply says, "Thanks." and jumps away. That's pretty gracious of them, considering the Rockmen's reputation.
It appears the Rock ship was long since abandoned. You strip what you can from it.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DISTRESS_QUESTION
event.text: You arrive near the distress beacon's signal.
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the five moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the six moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the seven moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"
You track the distress beacon with difficulty to one of the eleven moons of a planet hidden in the nebula.

As you drift closer, you are contacted by a Slug marooned on the moon's surface. "I shall join your crew, sssay I, if you can answer me this simple quesssstion. How many moons are there in orbit here?"

event.name: SLUG_DISTRESS_QUESTION_FALSE
event.text: "That issss... incorrect." Further, I have taken advantage of your lack of acuity to beam aboard your ship and steal your stuff!

event.name: SLUG_DISTRESS_QUESTION_TRUE
event.text: "That isss... correct. You sssurprise me. Human, is it? Yesss... we can be partners." The Slug beams aboard and joins your crew!

event.name: SLUG_DISTRESS_MANTIS
event.text: The distress call appears to be emanating from a Slug ship caught in open space by a Mantis raider. They contact you on emergency frequencies: "Please, we'll give you all we have if you sssave ussss!"
You lock onto the Mantis ship and engage.
You move to finish what the Mantis have started.

choice.text: Of all the species in the galaxy, these two deserve one another. You power up the jump drive.

event.text: It doesn't look like they can stand much more damage. After a few shots their ship breaks apart and you move in to loot the remains.
The Slug captain hails you: "A misstake! A sssimple misstake. Of course we can pay you! Ssseee? An augmentation has already transported." You allow them to leave with their lives.

event.name: SLUG_UNLOCK_SURRENDER
event.text: "You have besssted us! Will you accept what is in our storeesss in exchange for our livess?"
"Take thisss newly developed weapon we're transporting... They're not going to be happy we gave it up, that isss for ssure..."
This odd beam weapon does no damage to ships but instead greatly hurts the crew! Diabolical!

choice.text: We don't want the weapon, we want information.

event.text: You ask where they were delivering the weapon. "By telling you we will probably die jussst as like as not... Oh well." They give you the coordinates of the a prototype cruiser's mobile construction platform.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug feels that they can offer something special. Let them live.

event.text: "Take thisss newly developed weapon we're transporting... They're not going to be happy we gave it up, that isss for ssure..."
This odd beam weapon does no damage to ships but instead greatly hurts the crew! Diabolical!

choice.text: We don't want the weapon, we want information.

event.text: You ask where they were delivering the weapon. "By telling you we will probably die jussst as like as not... Oh well." They give you the coordinates of the a prototype cruiser's mobile construction platform.

event.name: SLUG_UNLOCK_1
event.text: You arrive to discover an impressive cruiser being worked on by a few smaller ships and guarded by an assault ship. The mobile construction platform is slowly slipping into the clouds. You have not yet been noticed.
As you approach, the assault ship swoops in on an intercept trajectory. Prepare for a fight!

choice.text: Try to tail them without being noticed.

event.name: SLUG_UNLOCK_2
event.text: You slip into the nebula undetected but at this rate you are likely to get lost and lose track of them.

choice.text: Fly slowly toward their last known position.

event.text: You are advancing slowly when suddenly the assault ship bursts through the clouds. They must have been able to detect you with their telepathy!

choice.text: Wait and hope the escort leaves.

event.text: You wait for a time before attempting to advance toward the platform. However, after some frantic searching you can't tell if they left or you simply miscalculated your trajectory... You give up the search and prepare to leave.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Have your crewmember monitor their life signatures.

event.text: You try to stay just far enough away that they won't detect your life signatures without actively searching for you. After a time, your Slug tells you the ship with a larger crew has jumped away. He guides the helm toward the platform...
The only ship left near the cruiser is an interceptor. This should be easy!

choice.text: (Improved Sensors) Try to maintain a lock on their ships from a distance.

event.text: You overclock your sensors, trying to get them to function in the clouds. They work just enough to let you keep tabs on their general position. After a time, the assault ship and most of the escort jumps away from the platform. You take the opportunity and move in to attack.
The only ship left near the cruiser is an interceptor. This should be easy!

event.name: SLUG_SURRENDER
event.text: "You have besssted us! Will you accept what isss in our storesss in exchange for our livess?"

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug knows what they are going to offer you as a reward.

event.text: "Here! We have lotsss of fuel! Take it all!"
"Take it and leave ussss be."
They transfer a decent amount of material. "There... now keep your word..."
They transfer some amount of material. "There... now keep your word..."
They transfer a meager amount of material. "There... now keep your word..."
Take thisss weapon and leave ussss be.
The Slugs, with a little bit of hesitation, give you some of their gel.
Their holds are completely empty, so then as compensation they offer you one of their own crew as your slave. You take them aboard, but decide to look after them better.

textList.name: START_BEACON_SLUG
textList.text: The only thing that can render a nebula more dangerous is if it's also home to the Slugs. This particular nebula is just that.
This nebula is home to the telepathic Slugs. They'd sell their own slime for a crate of scrap, but they much prefer to just take it.
You're told the Slug home world is somewhere in this nebula. You can't see them, but you know they're watching.

The Slugs that live in this nebula field are a leisure-centered civilization. Everything in Slug life is done in the pursuit of more currency and more time in which to spend it on extravagant ventures. This, inevitably, leads to much treachery in open space.

The Slugs developed on an ocean planet where the ability to telepathically sense another organism was more important than sight. Today they use this ability to navigate unfettered the depths of the nebulas they inhabit.

You've arrived in a Slug nebula. These harmful telepathic creatures are cunning and selfish to the core. When flying here, remember only one thing: they already know of your presence here. Be extremely careful.

Immediately upon arrival in the sector, you notice a fine weapon in perfect condition right at the side of the ship. The eyes of your crewmembers shine with joy, and the pilot takes out a bottle of Zoltan grog. However, upon turning the scanners on, you see it's only an asteroid. Is this another hypnotic trick of the sly Slugs?..
Nebulae have always been pretty dangerous places. The settlement of such sector by Slugs, ideally suited to such conditions, makes them an extremely unfavorable place...
The inscription on the beacon reads: "We know." Damn telepathic Slugs!
This sector is controlled by Slugs. These creatures are willing to do anything just to get precious scrap, so be on the alert!

This nebula is controlled by Slugs. It's worth knowing two things about this race: the first — Slugs lie just as readily as they breathe; and the second — they'll do anything and everything they can to take possession of your scrap, including open robbery.
An ancient legend says that there are Slugs that speak the truth... But the chance to find a living unicorn or Pegasus is much higher.

This nebula is infamous not so much for its storms, which make electronics go haywire, as by the Slugs inhabiting it. Actually, it can also be considered the second reason, as to why ships disappear here.

If slugs had a conscience or at least moral principles, they might well become great traders of the cosmos. But, apparently, that's too boring for them... And why buy something when you have the chance to take it for free?
You've moved into a nebula-filled sector. Sensors are out of order, but even without them you're left with the strange feeling that your ship's being closely watched.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DRINK
event.text: A Slug captain hails and invites himself aboard your ship to present a flask of something slimy. "Now, most gracioussss captain, you must join me please in a drink to our alliance!"
The Slug feigns offense at your refusal, but you sense that he respects your caution. This does not, however, prevent him from returning to his ship and opening fire.

choice.text: (Rock Crewmember) Have your Rockman pose as captain.

event.text: You take a cautious gulp. It's foul, but doesn't do any lasting damage. It's a thousand to one chance, but this Slug actually seems to be trustworthy. He casually celebrates your newfound trust by repairing part of your ship and offering to sell you his wares.
You take one gulp and wake up with the rest of the crew in the cargo hold... which contains noticeably less scrap than before.

Even if there was something malicious in the drink, you doubt it would affect the Rock digestive system. The Slug casually celebrates your newfound trust by repairing part of your ship and offering to sell you his wares.

Your crewmember is able to identify a heavy anaesthetic contained in the flask when he feels slightly drowsy (the Rock digestion system is very robust). His ruse discovered, the Slug immediately returns to his ship and opens fire.

event.name: NEBULA_QUEST_SLUG_PIRATE_TRAP
event.text: You arrive to the sight of two Slug ships in communication range. They don't see you.
You overhear their conversation and learn they're planning to raid an infamous and likely wealthy pirate ship in the area. The pair jump off and you note down their target co-ordinates.
You have no interest in anything the Slugs could make business out of. Time to move on.

event.name: QUEST_SLUG_PIRATE_TRAP2
event.text: You catch up with the two Slug ships and they're already carrying out their raid! One is in close combat with the pirate, the other seems to be heading for a small space cache the pirate was protecting.
Suddenly the first ship bursts into flames, and an urgent call arrives from the remaining Slugs. "We sssugest you distract the pirate vesssel while we retrieve the valuables. Fifty fifty sssplit."
There's money to be made here. The Slugs know that. You turn on the pirate and intercept just before he can reach the cache!
When he sees you making for the cache the Slug captain hails: "Foolish alienss, no eye for profit. Bessst of luck to you." They jump off, leaving you toe to toe with the pirate!

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DISTRESS_RESCUE
event.text: You detect life signs on a nearby moon - a lone Slug marooned on its surface. "Ah, a sssentient ssspecies, after all this time. I am Slocknog, a wandering hero ssseeking adventure. You may hire me for a ssmall sssum."
"I sssee you are a wise captain. I will enjoy thiss adventure." Slocknog buries the scrap somewhere deep within his folds of skin and joins your crew.

You power up the FTL, at which point the Slug sends an urgent plea. "Please, I ssee you are a sssly captain. You have an advantage. Very well. I will join your crew - but please remove me from this rock!"
When he sees the shuttle headed for his position the Slug thanks you with what looks like sincerity. He readily joins your crew.
You close the frequency and continue jump prep. If this Slug is such a hero he'll find a way off that moon on his own.

You power up the FTL Drive and give the order to jump. At the last moment you notice Slocknog running to your ship, but it's too late — a jet of flame from the engine vaporizes him into a small cloud of plasma... looks like you'll never know what he wanted to say...

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DISTRESS_TRICK
event.text: You find a Slug vessel broadcasting the distress signal and contact them. "Ah, yesss, we are having problems with our oxygen generation unit. Perhaps your crew can assist in repairsss?"
You know better than to trust the Slugs. You cut communications and prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Mantis Crewmember) Have your Mantis oversee the repairs.

event.text: Once on board, it becomes clear that nothing is wrong with their O2 system. Almost expecting this, your Mantis calmly responds to the trap. Once a couple of the Slugs have been spread across the walls of their ship, the rest surrender.

choice.text: (Directional Scanner) Check their oxygen room with your scanner.

event.text: The scanner reveals that their oxygen module is completely fine. Realizing that their deception is revealed, the Slugs angrily hiss and mount an offense.

The scan reveals that their oxygen module is indeed defective, so then a crewman is sent to the Slugs' aid. Soon the malfunction is eliminated and the Slugs send you a decent amount of scrap material in gratitude.

As soon as you board their ship their hostile intentions become clear. Despite being outnumbered, your crew is able to break free of the Slug trap and fight back to the airlock. You pull away from the enemy ship but not before a few Slugs make it on board.
As soon as you board their ship their hostile intentions become clear. On your way back to the airlock, one of your crewmembers is taken out by a well aimed Slug blaster shot.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was immediately revived by the Clone Bay.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

You cautiously board their ship and immediately smell the stale air of a malfunctioning life support. In no time at all you're able to fix up the problem and head off again with some extra scrap in your hold.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DISTRESS_PILOTING
event.text: The distress signal originates from a tampered jump beacon. A Slug vessel jumps in and announces he has hacked your engines system. "Of course if you, as one of the few remaining ships in the Federation, swear allegiance to the Slug Empire you will be free to go."
The Slug is unimpressed by your bravado and moves in to attack. Get the shields up, you're a sitting duck with malfunctioning thrusters!
You quickly re-wire through a secondary control module. Once they realize you're not likely to agree to their demands they move in to attack.
Your hacking system automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.
"Wow, I didn't think you'd go through with it..." replies their captain, "Looks like I owe you some scrap." Strangely enough, they let you leave.

Words come cheap, especially these ones. You assure the Slug of your loyalty and he welcomes you to the fold: "...and finally, let me introduce you to your new Slug Empire Overseer. He will ensure you stay true to the cause." A bored-looking Slug teleports over.

event.name: NEBULA_BATTLEFIELD
event.text: This nebula looks like it's recently seen two ships exchange fire... with mutually-assured destructive results. Wreckage drifts by your screens and tumbles into the depths of the nebula to be lost to sight. It's hard to determine who the combatants were without closer investigation.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Ask your Slug crew to scan for survivors.

event.text: Despite the destruction filling the system, your crewman is able to pick up the faint thoughts of a life form in the debris — it looks like they won't last much longer without help.

choice.text: Leave the battlefield before other ships arrive.
(Lifeform Scanner) Search for survivors using the lifeform scanner.

event.text: Despite the destruction filling the system, your scanner is able to pick up the faint thoughts of a life form in the debris - it looks like they won't last much longer without help.

choice.text: Leave the battlefield before other ships arrive.
Leave the battlefield before other ships arrive.

event.text: As you investigate the battlefield, your ship is pummeled by drifting wreckage - unable to detect anything of interest, you decide not to risk any further damage to your hull and prepare to jump.

The wreckage is drifting faster than it first appeared. You barely avoid being pummeled by drifting wreckage - unable to detect anything of interest, you decide not to risk your ship and prepare to jump.
You spot a life form floating within the wreckage.

choice.text: Leave the battlefield before other ships arrive.

event.text: You spot a life form floating within the wreckage.

choice.text: Leave the battlefield before other ships arrive.

event.name: BATTLEFIELD_SURVIVOR
event.text: Your bring the survivor aboard, but discover their wounds are severe. They won't live much longer.

choice.text: Make them comfortable for their final moments.

event.text: On their death bed, they croak out a series of coordinates and beg you to go there - when you attempt to ask them why, the survivor simply says, "ABADOTH" and perishes.

choice.text: (Improved Medbay) Get them into the medbay!

event.text: Using your upgraded medical bay, you are able to heal the survivor's wounds and they recover quickly. Grateful to be saved, they offer to join your crew and help however they can.

choice.text: (Clonebay) Try to clone them before it's too late.

event.text: You clone the individual and let the host pass away. The clone decides to join you — although it has little choice in the matter.

event.name: SECRET_WORD_ABADOTH
event.text: You have arrived at the coordinates given to you by the dead crewman you attempted to save. There doesn't seem to be anything here - no planets, no vessels, and no clue as to what he meant by sending you here.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Ask your Slug crewmember to scan for life forms.
(Lifeform Scanner) Check for signs of life using the lifeform scanner.
Do a full system scan — though you're sure to lose some of your lead with the Rebels.

event.text: You start the arduous task of a full system scan. This better be worth it.

event.name: SECRET_WORD_ABADOTH_CONCLUSION
event.text: A Zoltan ship decloaks and demands your reason for being here!

choice.text: Explain about finding the dead crewman.

event.text: There is a moment of silence, and suddenly the Zoltan ship cloaks — you must have said something wrong... now you've got a fight on your hands!

Your Engi crewman easily recalls the phrase the deadman used from its memory banks. There is a moment of silence, and the ship's captain solemnly thanks you for the information. He wishes you well on your journey, and he offers several upgrades to assist you in exchange for your service to the Zoltan race.
There is a moment of silence, and suddenly the Zoltan ship cloaks — must have been the wrong word to use... now you've got a fight on your hands!

There is a moment of silence, and the ship's captain solemnly thanks you for the information. He wishes you well on your journey, and he offers several upgrades to assist you in exchange for your service to the Zoltan race.
There is a moment of silence, and suddenly the Zoltan ship cloaks — must have been the wrong word to use... now you've got a fight on your hands!

textList.name: START_BEACON_UNSTABLE
textList.text: Данный сектор категорически не пригоден для жизни. Сверхактивные звёзды, чёрные дыры и пульсары превратили местные планеты в груды камней...
Близость данного сектора к чёрной дыре превратила его в настоящий ад для всего живого. Ни один адекватный капитан не поведёт своё судно в эти места...
Этот сектор славится ужасными условиями для продвижения торговых кораблей. Только самые жадные и безумные торговцы срезают дорогу через этот сектор...
Этот сектор считается "бермудским треугольником" Галактики. Количество пропавших тут кораблей уже давно стало несчётным...
Поговаривают, что в этом нестабильном секторе обитает отшельническая группа слизней, помешанных на технологиях взлома...
Этот опасный сектор стал прибежищем для пиратов...

textList.name: START_BEACON_UNSTABLE_2
textList.text: ...однако, флот повстанцев потеряет значительно больше времени, чтобы догнать вас.
...флот повстанцев не ожидал, что вы отправитесь сюда, и теперь тратит время для реорганизации преследования.
...продвижение повстанцев здесь будет затруднено.
...флот преследования, несомненно, будет задержан местными аномалиями.
...флот повстанцев тратит время на подготовку к полёту в этом секторе.
...повстанцы долго не решаются преследовать вас в этом опасном месте.

textList.name: NOTHING_UNSTABLE_1
textList.text: The jump opens to empty space. The local beacon serves only as a reference point for a route plan.
You jump into an unremarkable system. There aren't any signs of life within scanning range.
Your jump opens out to an entirely ordinary binary star system. All around is emptiness.
Your jump exits out to an empty beacon. Strange that it's so calm here...
You find yourself near a lifeless planet. It's strange that it's still surviving despite all the cataclysms and calamities that befell this sector.

event.text: Looks like a battle is inevitable...

textList.name: NEBULA_ASTEROID_HOSTILE_JELLYHACK
textList.text: As you enter the nebula, you notice an asteroid field hidden within a dense layer of clouds. You also notice a clearly unfriendly Slug ship.
Turns out the nebula is hiding a huge asteroid field, and you're flying into it at full speed! In the midst of this, you encounter a Hacker ship turning towards you...
Inside this nebula is an asteroid field, but the surprises don't end there — A Hacker ship is preparing to hack your systems!
The nebula at this beacon hides an asteroid field. Just when you thought it couldn't get any worse, a Hacker ship appears out of nowhere, shattering your hopes.

event.text: Among the pile of wreckage from the hacker ship you notice a surviving weapon.
When you examine the hacker ship for scrap, you find a weapon that survived the battle.
Among the pile of wreckage from the hacker ship you notice a surviving weapon.
When you examine the hacker ship for scrap, you find a weapon that survived the battle.
You prepare to fight back against the arrogant and slimy creatures.

textList.name: NEBULA_SUN_HOSTILE_JELLYHACK
textList.text: Flying into the nebula, you mark a rapid increase in temperature of nearby gas — somewhere nearby is an overactive star, and to top it off there's a Slug ship on your tail!

As soon as you fly into the nebula at this beacon, the overboard temperature begins to rise rapidly. A massive red giant, hidden until now, threatens to melt your ship! A Hacker ship emerges nearby, aggravating the situation...
A red giant and a hostile Hacker ship — not the best surprises to find hidden within this sector's nebulae.
This nebula's hot — the proximity of the supermassive giant wouldn't be that bad, were it not for the hostile Slugs that jumped straight towards you.

event.text: Suddenly an automated ship sweeps past you. It looks like it tried to ram right into you and missed, but now it's turning around for a second attempt!

textList.name: SUN_ASTEROID_HOSTILE_AUTOSHIP
textList.text: You complete your jump near the dense asteroid fields of a class M5 star...
A bunch of asteroids are caught in the gravitational trap of a supermassive giant. What genius came up with the idea to install a jump beacon in this place?!
The hot class M star here has a large asteroid field collected around it in a small orbit. In the midst of this beauty, your ship appears from the jump.
A hot supergiant and an asteroid field threaten to destroy your ship. Not exactly the best place to exit the jump...

deadCrew.text: You killed the crew and cleaned their holds. In general, the crew is not here, so just say hello to my mom.

event.text: Before you go to the store, you notice a pile of scrap floating past. Trying not to attract any attention, you quickly drag it all into the hold.

textList.name: STORM_STORE_UNSTABLE_STORM_TEXT
textList.text: In this unfavorable place a trader has decided to open up a trading platform. Strange decision...
"Welcome to this automated trading station." Strange, you don't see any staff anywhere.
A Slug-trader invites you to look at their goods. All-time high discounts today only!
Right inside the storm cloud is a small trade station. Hopefully, the bad weather will not prevent you from making a deal.
Flashes of lightning periodically illuminate a small trade station near this beacon.

event.name: ASTEROID_ROCK_MINING
event.text: Coming out of the jump, you fly straight into an asteroid field. The Rock ship nearby hails:
"Damned insects! You found us here, too? Well then!"
"Greetings! We're mining rare ore... but how did you get here?"

choice.text: Tell them about your mission and ask for help.

event.text: No conversation. You decide to take apart their ship for scrap.

choice.text: (Scrap Recovery Arm) Help the Rockmen to mine the ore.

event.text: Together, you quickly fill each other's holds with valuable scrap.
Satisfied, the Rockmen give you some of their supplies.

choice.text: (Scythe Beam) Help the Rockmen to mine the ore.

event.text: Together, you quickly fill each other's holds with valuable scrap.
Satisfied, the Rockmen give you some of their supplies.

choice.text: (Chain Beam) Help the Rockmen to mine the ore.

event.text: Together, you quickly fill each other's holds with valuable scrap.
Satisfied, the Rockmen give you some of their supplies.
The Rockmen carefully listen then give you some supplies for the sake of saving the Federation.
The Rockmen carefully listen then give you part of their supplies for the sake of saving the Federation.
The Rockmen don't care for your requests for help as they don't care about the Federation.
You get ready to seize their supplies by force.
The Rockmen are glad to help, but they claim their holds are empty.
You decide to personally check the fullness of their holds.

event.name: PULSAR_ASTEROID_HOSTILE_JELLYHACK
event.text: The beacon you jumped to is located near a pulsar. Moreover, you notice dense asteroid fields around.
Suddenly, a Slug-Hacker ship flies out from behind an asteroid "You cannot leave thiss place! Give usss everything, and we'll ssspare your life!"
The Slugs completely clean out your ship... Well, at least everyone survived...
The Slugs charge up their weapons.

event.name: STORM_SLUGS_UNSTABLE_TRADER
event.text: The captain of a Slug ship hails you, very obtrusively inviting you to buy a weapon from them.
You load the goods on board, and the Slugs, rather than splashing about with their slime, accept your payment.
"Iss that ssso?! You have wassted our time, and for thisss you will pay." You notice a Slug in a small spacesuit flies away from your ship with a small container! They stole something from you!

"Iss that ssso?! You have wassted our time, and for thisss you will pay." The Slug ship charges their weapons, and you notice a Slug aboard your ship — it's stuck, trying to discreetly lockpick its way through one of the doors.

escape.text: They seem to be trying to escape!

gotaway.text: Their ship made an FTL jump in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect all the scrap that remains.

deadCrew.text: You killed their crew, so you're able to clean out their holds.

event.name: STORM_SLUG_CONVERTER_OF_SOUL
event.text: You fly into an ion storm. A nearby Slug ship hails: "Hello, we've found an esssoteric artifact. The ancient runess written on it indicate it can transssform the ssoulsss of intelligent beingss, but we're too afraid to try it on oursselvesss. Sssend us ssomebody for an experiment, and we'll make it worth your while."

choice.text: Select a crewmember for an experiment.

event.text: Who will you send to the Slugs' artifact?
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
You send your crewmember to the strange artifact. There's a strange sound and it draws them inward, then everything fades...
We're in this sector only for the sake of scrap, and this ship will become another one of our prey.

choice.text: We, too, are afraid to conduct such experiments. Refuse them.

event.text: Discontented, the Slugs squelch their tentacles and break off communications.
Discontented, the Slugs squelch their tentacles and break off communications.
Discontented, the Slugs cut off communications and start charging their weapons. Looks like they don't take no for an answer.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact. Inside... there is nothing... the Slugs say that this has never happened before and ask you to leave.

choice.text: Attack them. We will not forgive this!

event.text: You start charging up your weapons. The Slugs in response do the same!
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Suddenly a slimy cocoon comes out of the artifact, and your new crewmember crawls out of it... The Slugs make some measurements and give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.

destroyed.text: Their ship breaks apart, and you collect all the scrap that remains.

deadCrew.text: You killed their crew, so you're able to clean out their holds.

event.name: UNSTABLE_BLACKHOLE_RANDOMIZER_3000
event.text: You arrive at this beacon to find a huge gaping anomaly. A Slug ship nearby hails: "Shipss conssstantly fly out of thiss ssspatial dissstortion, compressssed through from the other endsss of the Galaxy. Give us a ssspectacle! If you defeat an alien, we'll make it worth your while."
You rush in to attack the first ship that zooms out of the anomaly!
Seeing your intentions, they make a desperate maneuver and disappear into the anomaly. You think about following them when your better judgement kicks in.
You decide it's best to just fly away from here as soon as possible.

destroyed.text: You quickly inspect the debris and collect everything of value. The Slug-watchers jump away as soon as the fight ends. Clearly, they never intended to pay at all.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off their crew, you take everything of value. The Slug-watchers jump away as soon as the fight ends. Clearly, they never intended to pay at all.

event.name: NEBULA_UNSTABLE_FED_BARGE_EVENT
event.text: A nearby freighter tells you they're in a serious shortage of ammunition and ask if you can give them any.
You ship them the required number of missiles.
The captain of the freighter thanks you and gives you one of the weapons lying around in their hold and some scrap.
You ship them the remains of your missiles.
The captain of the freighter thanks you and gives you one of the weapons lying around in their hold and a bit of scrap.

choice.text: (Explosive Replicator) Give them time to make a copy of your replicator.

event.text: The freighter's crew make an exact copy of your replicator. In gratitude for giving them your time, they send you a missile weapon and some scrap.
You decide to take them by force, a most reliable path.
You apologize, but you just don't have spare ammunition.

destroyed.text: You quickly inspect the debris and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off their crew, you take of everything of value.

event.text: In the depths of their hold, you find an entire missile weapon and take it for yourself.
A few moments later, you realize that you're amidst a sparse asteroid field!

textList.name: ASTEROID_PULSAR_UNSTABLE_OLDPIRATE
textList.text: Coming out of the jump, you pinpoint an old ship with pirate coloring. Soon they hail you: "This pulsar will do everything for us! Don't even try to get away!"
You exit the jump next to a fast pulsar. An old pirate ship appears after you and immediately turns to attack.
An old pirate ship was waiting for you at this beacon. The situation is complicated by a pulsar ready to disable ship systems.

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

event.text: There isn't a single pirate left on the ship, so you take away materials that look useful.
There isn't a single pirate left on the ship, so you take away all materials that look useful.
The pirates are dead, so you can collect fuel from their stores, along with all available scrap.
The pirates are dead, so you can collect all fuel from their storage, along with all available scrap.
You manage to kill off the gang of pirates. You find a prisoner aboard their ship and invite them to join your crew.
You managed to deal with the gang of pirates. On their ship you find a captive human.
The former prisoner embarks on their new duties.

choice.text: Drop them off at the next station.

event.text: For saving them, they give you everything of value that was not stolen from them.
You find a laser weapon aboard the pirate ship. With no one to stop you, you take it for yourself.
You get ready to teach them a lesson.

textList.name: NEBULA_PULSAR_HOSTILE_JELLYHACK
textList.text: Flying into the nebula, you can see the increased ionization of gases overboard — somewhere nearby an active pulsar. Suddenly, a Slug ship sits on your tail!
As soon as you fly into the nebula of this beacon, your sensors start to signal an approaching ion flash. Suddenly a Hacker ship appears, complicating the situation...
In the depths of the nebula is a hidden pulsar, ready at any time to turn off all your ship's systems. A hostile Hacker ship's going to take advantage of this.
It turns out the nebula here's hiding an active pulsar! A Hacker ship has already flown out to meet you and take advantage of your confusion.

event.text: A few moments later you realize that you're right in the middle of an asteroid field!

textList.name: ASTEROID_SUN_UNSTABLE_OLDPIRATE
textList.text: Coming out of the jump, you pinpoint an old ship with pirate coloring. Soon they hail: "Prepare the contents of your holds, now it will be ours!"
You exit the jump next to a star. An old pirate ship appears right after you and immediately turns to attack.

An old pirate ship sits on your tail near this beacon. The situation is complicated by a star, just about ready to shed its external shell with a powerful explosion... You're both clearly here at the wrong time.
You appear next to a hot M class giant. An old pirate cruiser, neglecting the danger, goes to intercept you.

event.text: Suddenly, at full speed, you fly into a dense asteroid field!

textList.name: ASTEROID_SUN_UNSTABLE_SHIPS_ROCK_PIRATE
textList.text: Right next to the active binary star, you spot a Rock ship. Looks like they ran out of fuel and got stuck here. Now you are their only hope to survive. They charge up their weapons looking to take all your fuel.
You exit the jump next to the double star. Out of nowhere a pirate ship sits at your tail.

A pirate ship sits on your tail near this beacon. The situation is complicated by a star, just about ready to shed its external shell with a powerful explosion... You're both clearly here at the wrong time.
Here, a Rock pirate ship awaits hapless travelers. The hot double star only adds to the danger.

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off their crew, you take everything of value.

textList.name: STORM_DISTRESS
textList.text: The distress signal was transmitted by a broken civilian ship. Unfortunately, you arrived too late, all that's left to do is to collect everything of value...
The distress signal leads you to the wreckage of a Hacker ship — by some miracle their transmitter has remained unscathed. You rob them clean and move on.
An old pirate ship breaks apart right before your eyes as you appear at this beacon. You collect everything of value from its wreckage.
You notice the civilians transmitting the distress signal. Another flash of lightning hits their ship and causes an explosion! No survivors remain...

textList.name: STORM_DISTRESS_EMPTY
textList.text: The distress signal cuts out as soon as you appear at the beacon. You don't dare stay for long and give the order to depart.
Suddenly, an ion storm starts out of nowhere and absorbs the distress signal before you have time to find its source. You feel the urgent need to fly away from here.
The static sea absorbs all the signals at this beacon. You wonder how anyone could be found here at all.
It looks as though the ion storm caused a failure in your equipment — you don't see any source of disaster nearby.

textList.name: STORM_DISTRESS_OLD_PIRATE
textList.text: Turns out an old pirate ship asked for help. However, after seeing you, they go on the attack.
A lone pirate ship got lost in an ion storm. As soon as they notice you, they immediately get ready to attack.
The distress signal was transmitted by a pirate ship. Looks like you've fallen into a trap!
Pirates await unwary travelers in this ion storm. You've just become their next victim.

textList.name: STORM_DISTRESS_HACKER
textList.text: The distress signal was transmitted by a Hacker ship. It doesn't look like they need any help whatsoever.
The Hacker ship used the distress beacon as bait, and you've caught right onto it.
You fly straight into a Hacker trap: there's no disaster here.
Flashes of lightning illuminate the Hacker ship right in front of you — it's a trap!

textList.name: NEBULA_HOSTILE_OLD_PIRATE
textList.text: Pirates waiting in ambush at this nebula attack you as soon as you appear from the jump.
Drifting about in the nebula is a pirate ship. Seeing you, they go on the attack.
This beacon's nebula isn't safe. As soon as you appear, a pirate ship rushes to meet you.
An old pirate ship awaits its victims in the nebula of this beacon. It's time to teach these scoundrels a lesson!
The local nebula seems to be safe at first glance. Suddenly, a pirate ship appears, shattering those hopes.
Due to the dense nebula clouds, a pirate ship rushes towards you. A battle is inevitable.
The dense nebula cloud conceals an old pirate ship until the last moment. It's too late now to avoid the battle.
The beacon seemed lifeless, until an old pirate ship jumps in right after you. The nebula will only serve to help them.
The beacon looks empty, and you almost give the order to jump when suddenly a pirate ship appearing makes you change your mind.
Pirates! You can't even hide from them in the nebula. With this thought, you give the order to charge up your weapons.

textList.name: HOSTILE_OLD_PIRATE
textList.text: As soon as you exit the jump, a pirate ship flies towards you: their hostile intentions are beyond doubt.
Right in fron of you is an old pirate ship, and they're already preparing to attack.
A pirate ship patrols this beacon. Once they see you, they go on the offensive.
You stumble upon an old pirate ship. Seeing you, they charge up their weapons.
Pirates appear right in front of you as soon as you jump into this place. Combat cannot be avoided.
An old pirate ship is scampering around in search of a suitable victim. Having seen you, they prepare for battle.
Directly in front of you — pirates. Get ready to fight!
Pirates unexpectedly appearing after you don't leave you with much of a choice. Charge up all the weapons!
The old pirate ship still poses a threat to passing ships. They charge up all their weapons when they see you.
The pirates settled at this beacon are not averse to stuffing their holds with your supplies. We must stop them!

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off their crew, you take everything of value.

surrender.text: They contact your ship: "You've won! Let us go!"

event.text: You take the supplies and leave them alone.

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off their crew, you take everything of value.

surrender.text: They contact your ship: "You've won! Let us go!"

event.text: You take the supplies and leave them alone.

textList.name: HOSTILE_HACKER
textList.text: A Hacker ship flies out to meet you. Their intentions are never friendly.
As soon as you appear, you notice a Hacker flying in your direction — the Hackers have settled here to ambush unsuspecting passers-by!

Noticing a Hacker ship in the distance, you consider how nice it would be to get their blaster weaponry. As if reading your thoughts, their ship rapidly approaches, simultaneously charging up their weapons.
You're find yourself ambushed by Slugs; their Hacker ship is already flying in your direction!
The Hacker ship nearby doesn't let you take a breath and immediately goes on the offensive.
Unfortunately, you're ambushed by Hackers. Not allowing you to recover, they go to battle.
Directly from underneath your ship a Hacker ship slips out at great speed, it makes a couple of aerobatics and, charging up their weapons, turns in your direction!
Slugs nearby say something unintelligible, lisping and squelching into the communicator, after which they move in to attack.

event.text: You send them the amount of fuel they require.
You decide that their ship will be excellent prey for you. The Rockmen prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Refuse them and charge up your FTL Drive.

event.text: The Rockmen crumble with gratitude, but give you absolutely nothing. At least you did a good deed...
The Rockmen thank you and send some of their supplies.
The Rockmen thank you and send a bit of their supplies.
The Rockmen are extremely unhappy with your decision to leave them drifting here and promptly cut off communication channels.
Since you refuse to help in an amicable way, the Rockmen decide to take you by force. Prepare to fight!
Since you refuse to help in an amicable way, the Rockmen decide to take you by force. Prepare to fight!

textList.name: SUN_UNSTABLE_ROCK_NOFUEL
textList.text: Next to the star you come across a Rock ship. They ran out of fuel, and ask
There's a Rock ship stuck near this hot star with empty fuel tanks. They ask you for some fuel to get away from this dangerous place.
The distress signal was transmitted by a Rock ship, stuck without fuel at an active star. They ask if you can share some of your fuel.

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect some scrap.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off their crew, you take everything of value.

textList.name: SUN_UNSTABLE_TRAP
textList.text: The distress signal turns out to be a trap! A Hacker ship attacks you, ignoring the close proximity of the hot star.
You arrive at the distress call and fall right into an ambush. Hackers are attacking you, despite the dangerous proximity of the active star.
You feel that it wasn't worth flying here. A Hacker ship was waiting here for captains to respond to the distress signal near the huge hot star...

event.text: You collect the debris, dodging asteroids along the way.

textList.name: NEBULA_ASTEROID_FREE
textList.text: The nebula here hides a large asteroid field. Some ship, apparently, couldn't get out of here; its remains rust past you.
You fly into a suspicious looking nebula. Your worst fears are justified when you realize you're right in the middle of an asteroid field! The remains of some unfortunate ship are passing by...
Because of the asteroid field hidden in this nebula, many ships have crashed. You stumble upon the remains of one such victim in this dangerous place.
You stumble upon the remains of a pirate ship that crashed in an asteroid field. Not very surprising, considering the fact that it's completely hidden by the nebula.

event.name: EVENT_UNSTABLE_SLUG_INEEDTOGO
event.text: Before you, the FTL Drive of a fairly battered Slug ship is charging.
You notice they don't have functioning shields and weapons.

escape.text: You receive a message from them: "We were heavily battered in an ion ssstorm, and now we're just flying home. Don't touch usss, and we'll leave you sssomething of value. We don't need thisss anymore..."

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off their crew, you take everything of value.

event.text: You inspect the place of their jump exit, but don't find anything — the Slugs tricked you. Again!
You inspect the place of their jump exit, and find a drone which the Slugs must have dropped from their hold at the last moment.
You inspect the place of their jump exit, and find a weapon which the Slugs must have dropped from their hold at the last moment.
You inspect the place of their jump exit, and find a weapon which the Slugs must have dropped from their hold at the last moment.

event.name: STORM_EVENT_KILLAVATAR
event.text: Сразу по прибытию вы попадаете в сильнейшую электромагнитную бурю!..
...Ваша команда возится некоторое время с системами корабля и частично восстанавливает их работоспособность. Время убираться отсюда...

...Это аномальное место губительно для аватаров. Аватар в вашей команде исчезает, и от него не остаётся ничего, кроме проектора. Вы разбираете его на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...
...Все аватары в вашей команде исчезают, и от них не остаётся ничего, кроме проекторов. Вы разбираете их на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...
...Все аватары в вашей команде исчезают, и от них не остаётся ничего, кроме проекторов. Вы разбираете их на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...
...Все аватары в вашей команде исчезают, и от них не остаётся ничего, кроме проекторов. Вы разбираете их на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...
...Все аватары в вашей команде исчезают, и от них не остаётся ничего, кроме проекторов. Вы разбираете их на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...
...Все аватары в вашей команде исчезают, и от них не остаётся ничего, кроме проекторов. Вы разбираете их на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...
...Все аватары в вашей команде исчезают, и от них не остаётся ничего, кроме проекторов. Вы разбираете их на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...
...Молнии снаружи стихают, и команда начинает расходиться по рабочим местам, однако сконденсировавшийся на приборных панелях заряд разряжается в аватара!..
...Все аватары в вашей команде исчезают, и от них не остаётся ничего, кроме проекторов. Вы разбираете их на лом и частично восстанавливаете работу отключённых систем. Время убираться отсюда...

textList.name: NEBULA_EVENT_KILLAVATAR_TEXT
textList.text: ...Яркая вспышка молнии прорезает темноту помещений корабля и испаряет одного из ваших аватаров!..
...Откуда-то из глубины корабля раздаётся хлопок и вы понимаете, что ещё одного аватара не стало...
...Очередной электрический разряд пробегает по обшивке корабля и дезинтегрирует аватара...

textList.name: NEBULA_EVENT_KILLAVATAR_TEXT2
textList.text: ...Электрический импульс из ближайшего облака разрежённого газа пронзает пустоту космоса и бьёт прямо в аватара!..
...Высоковольтный разряд бьёт по вашему кораблю. Тонкая электроника аватара не выдерживает и взрывается...
...Ваша команда тихо прячется вдали от электроники корабля, пока не стихнет буря, но внезапный разряд попадает в аватара и уничтожает его...

textList.name: NEBULA_EVENT_KILLAVATAR_TEXT3
textList.text: ...Ваш аватар пытается восстановить работу систем корабля, но высоковольтный разряд от пульта повреждает его проектор...
...Молния пронзает изоляцию корабля и убивает вашего аватара!..
...Яркое белое пятно проносится по корридорам корабля и, врезавшись в аватара, взрывается!..

textList.name: NEBULA_EVENT_KILLAVATAR_TEXT4
textList.text: ...Ваш аватар решает выглянуть в иллюминатор, чтобы проверить, не стихла ли буря, но получает смертельный удар молнии!..
...Кто-то из вашей команды начинает впадать в отчаяние, и ваш аватар подходит к нему, чтобы успокоить, но получает смертельный высоковольтный разряд!..
...Ваш аватар берёт с собой самодельный "молниеотвод" и пытается восстановить работу систем корабля. К сожалению, это не срабатывает, и шаровая молния повреждает его проекционный модуль...

textList.name: NEBULA_EVENT_KILLAVATAR_TEXT5
textList.text: ...Светящися энергетический шар почти мгновенно пронзает корабль, и ещё одного аватара больше нет...
...Очередной удар молнии попадает в вашего аватара!..

textList.name: NEBULA_EVENT_KILLAVATAR_TEXT6
textList.text: ...Где-то в соседнем отсеке раздаётся хлопок. Забежав туда, вы находите лишь пустой проекционный модуль аватара...
...Воздух рядом с аватаром начинает электризоваться всё сильнее, пока аватар не отключается. Вы пытаетесь починить его, но всё бесполезно...

event.name: NEBULA_EVENT_DAMAGE_FTLJUMP
event.text: Похоже, что ваша система расчёта FTL-прыжков в этот раз дала сбой...

textList.name: EVENT_DAMAGE_FTLJUMP_TEXT
textList.text: ...сразу после FTL-прыжка на вашем корабле раздаётся взрыв! Видимо, в точке прыжка был космический мусор!
...при выходе из FTL-прыжка на корабле раздаётся взрыв! Оказывается, вы прыгнули прямо в обломки разрушенного возле маяка корабля!
...по завершении прыжка внутри корабля что-то взрывается. Взглянув на приборы, вы понимаете, что ваш FTL-прыжок завершился прямо на обломках какого-то корабля.

event.text: Обломки металлолома оказываются внутри вашего корабля!
Обломки металлолома оказываются внутри вашего корабля!
Обломки металлолома оказываются внутри вашего корабля!
Среди обломков вы находите орудие, и оно ещё функционирует!
Среди обломков вы находите дрона, и он ещё функционирует!
Среди обломков вы находите какого-то дрона. Дрон безнадёжно сломан, но удалось разобрать его на запасные части.
Среди обломков вы находите какое-то ракетное орудие. Уцелело лишь несколько боеголовок.
They prepare to defend themselves.

choice.text: Quickly charge up the engines and jump away.

textList.name: NEUTRAL_HACKER
textList.text: You notice a Hacker ship flying at some distance from you. They seem to be in no hurry to attack.
Directly before flies a Hacker ship, completely ignoring you.
A Hacker ship flying nearby doesn't show any hostile intentions towards you.
Next to you from the jump appears a Hacker ship. They're somewhere in a hurry about their business and pay no attention to you.

event.name: BATTLE_PIRATE_BOSS
event.text: Oh my God! A Pirate Flagship flies right at you!

escape.text: The Flagship is charging up their FTL Drive!

gotaway.text: The pirates fled in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: You briefly inspect the wreckage and collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off the pirates, you take everything of value.

event.text: The pirates are trying to escape through a nearby asteroid field.
You rush for the pirates into the asteroid field.
You decide you'll be better off leaving them alone.
The pirates are trying to hide behind the nearest star.
You rush for the pirates directly towards the red-hot star.
You decide you'll be better off leaving them alone.
The pirates are trying to hide behind the nearest pulsar.
You rush for the pirates directly to the pulsar.
You decide you'll be better off leaving them alone.

textList.name: START_BEACON_SLURM
textList.text: This sector is populated by Slugs with rather unusual hobbies. They cook a special mixture called Slurm. Who knows why they do this?..
In this sector there is a special Slug faction, which calls itself the Slig. They are not as aggressive as other Slugs, but that doesn't mean they're less deadly...
Sligs are engaged in extracting secretions from giant Slugs and brewing them with various other materials into a beverage called, "Slurm". To some extent, this replaces the long lost Slug gel...
Rumours have it that there are Slugs in this sector of monstrous proportions, almost the size of an entire ship! These are most likely just legends, but it's better to have your wits about you.
You see the inscription, "Slig Abode", etched into a slimy green plate nailed to the jump beacon.
Sligs in this sector are friendlier than most other Slugs, but their cunning remains ever present. Be on the alert.
Immediately upon arrival in this sector, you get the feeling someone is watching you. The scanners detect nothing, but your instincts have never failed you...

event.name: SLURM_FUEL
event.text: A Slig ship slowlys approaches you. They're going to cook Slurm based from fuel capsules and are ready to buy some from you at a good price.
"We'll pay you 5 scrap for every fuel capsule you can offer us." How much fuel will you sell?
You're making a deal.
You're making a deal.
You're making a deal.
You're making a deal.

choice.text: We are not interested in such an offer.
We don't have time for this.

textList.name: NOTHING_SLURM
textList.text: You appear at an unremarkable beacon. It doesn't look like there's anything more to do here, and you give the order to jump.
At the very limit of the scanners you notice a Slig settlement. Going there would mean losing several jump cycles, so you give the order for an immediate jump to the next beacon.
The Sligs have made a landfill here at this beacon, plastic Slurm barrels drifting everywhere. A quick scan shows all of them are empty.
Near the beacon there is nothing interesting, except for a lone barrel dripping its last drops of Slurm. To your disappointment, it is empty...

textList.name: NEBULA_NOTHING_SLURM
textList.text: You stumble upon the remains of a Slig ship. Inside there is nothing useful at all, undoubtedly the handiwork of marauders.
In the nebula ahead you see glimpses of a Slig ship. You give orders to catch up with them, but they disappear into the nebula's depths before you can get close.
In this nebula, the Sligs have made a landfill. Everywhere, plastic Slurm barrels drift about. A quick scan shows all of them to be empty.
The nebula in front of you is beautiful, but absolutely empty.
In the nebula, a Slig ship flashes before you. You rapidly approach, but it turns out to be a cosmic mirage...

textList.name: NEBULA_ITEMS_TEXT
textList.text: You stumble upon the remains of a Slig ship. Inside are some supplies.
You meet a Slig ship. "Welcome, strangers! We've heard about you!" They throw you a container of supplies and disappear before you have time to comprehend what just happened...
In this nebula, the Sligs have set up a garbage dump, plastic Slurm barrels drifting all throughout. In some, you find the remnants of useful materials, from which the Sligs boil their brews.
In the nebula before you flashes a Slig ship. You quickly approach and find a tattered ship. Inside are some supplies.
Right on you from the nebula drift out the remains of a Mantis ship. Inside you find some supplies. This sector makes you think, because usually there are remains of Mantis victims...

choice.text: Buy a token for 1 scrap and go to the slot machine.

textList.name: NEBULA_STORE_SLURM
textList.text: You arrive at a Slig trade station. An old Slurm offers you to play a slot machine before trading.
You arrive at a Slig trade station. In the corner there is a slot machine, from which a Slurm slithers out swearing. Looks like they lost the last of their money.
The Sligs have a passion for gambling. It's no wonder that you find a slot machine in a regular store.

event.name: SLURM_777_AVTOMAT
event.text: You buy a token and look at the winnings table of the machine. It looks like you can win some equipment for the ship!

choice.text: Start the game on the slot machine.

event.name: SLURM_777_AVTOMAT_KLIN
event.text: Looks like the slot machine jammed. You go shopping, not winning anything...

textList.name: SLURM_777_AVTOMAT_LOSE_TEXT
textList.text: The machine flashes lights and an unsuccessful combination lights up on the scoreboard.
You put a token in, but the scoreboard lights up with a losing combination.
You start the game, but the screen lights up with a losing combination.
With hope, you pull the lever, but this time, no luck...
Unfortunately, you get an unsuccessful combination.
The slot machine creaks its rusty gears and announces "LOSS!!!" Someone from your crew screams loudly...
You await your winnings, but the slot machine tells you that today is an unlucky day.
You wait for a while, but the slot machine gives the word "FAILURE!!!"
This time, no luck, but the next will definitely be lucky!
Failure! A crewman violently demands to continue the game!
You are just about ready to break the damned machine, which keeps on absorbing your savings...
You lose! A Slig slithers away, bragging of winning yesterday.
On the scoreboard — LOSS. A crewman tells you that your gambling will ruin the Federation.
On the scoreboard there is a losing combination and the words: "The next token will definitely be successful! Play again!"
You lose! Your crew look at each other and advise you to stop...
You lose! A crewman tries to open the back panel of the slot machine to return the token, but cannot unscrew it...
Loss! You forcefully beat up the slot machine, and your crew start to get nervous.
Loss! The slot machine, meanwhile, runs a Slurm advertisement at the bottom of the screen.
Failure! Your crew look at what is happening, but don't stop you.
Failure! The slot machine again waits for a token, and from somewhere nearby comes the squelching laughter of the Sligs.
On the scoreboard appears a losing combination and the words: "All funds received by this slot machine will be used to destroy a giant creature in the Engi sector."

event.text: The slot machine lights up with bright lights, and you get your winnings!

choice.text: Buy another token and continue the game.
End the game and go shopping.

event.name: PONY_GAME_EVENT
event.text: You buy a token and throw it into the machine. The dusty screen shows the head of a pony and the menu has the following buttons:
The options menu consists of the following buttons:
The update menu consists of the following buttons:
The slot machine starts downloading updates: "Time until the download is complete — 1 minute."
The slot machine starts downloading updates: "Time until the download is complete — 10 minutes."
The slot machine starts downloading updates: "Time until the download is complete — 2 hours."
The slot machine starts downloading updates: "Time until the download is complete — 1 day."
The slot machine starts downloading updates: "Time until the download is complete — 7 days."
The slot machine starts downloading updates: "Time until the download is complete — 61 days." A crewman pulls you away from the slot machine. It looks like you got carried away...
You don't have time to wait. No one else will save the Federation.
You don't have time to wait. No one else will save the Federation.
You don't have time to wait. No one else will save the Federation.
You don't have time to wait. No one else will save the Federation.
You don't have time to wait. No one else will save the Federation.
You select the "EXIT" button and the slot machine turns off. You haven't forgotten that the Rebel Fleet's pursuing you.
The pony runs to the finish line, and from the slot machine you get a reward. That's a WIN!
The pony runs to the finish line, and from the slot machine you get a reward. That's a WIN!
The pony runs to the finish line, and from the slot machine you get a reward. That's a WIN!
The pony runs to the finish line, and from the slot machine you get a reward. That's a WIN!
