A beautiful pony is shown on the corner of the screen. It runs along the lawn and the sun shines on its golden mane. Suddenly a fence appears in front! What to do?!
The pony opens its mouth and from it flows a laser stream directly into the fence! However, the fence remains whole and the pony, crashing into it, falls dead. GAME OVER.
The pony confidently accelerates, kicking its legs faster, and with great force, crashes its head into the fence. After this blow, it falls dead to the ground. GAME OVER.
The pony makes a magnificent and, landing, continues to run forward. Now in front of you there is a huge bat!
The pony jumps straight into the bat, and it bites the pony. You see how the pony weakens after the bite and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony accelerates, kicking its feet faster, but the bat catches up and bites its back leg. After a bite, the pony weakens and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony opens its mouth and a laser stream flows from there! It burns the bat to the ground and continues running. Ahead you see a swamp. What to do?!
The pony jumps right into the swamp and helplessly gets stuck in it. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out, and looks sadly into your eyes. GAME OVER.

The pony shoots a laser into the swamp and causes a massive vapor cloud. Unable to see anything, the pony finds itself in a viscous place and helplessly gets stuck. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out, and looks sadly into your eyes. GAME OVER.
The pony swiftly runs through the swamp and overcomes the obstacle with a smile. Ahead — a huge fire-breathing dragon! What to do?!
The pony jumps right into the dragon's mouth. The monster is extremely surprised, but chews and swallows this gift of fate. GAME OVER.
The pony shoots a laser into the dragon, but it doesn't burn its scales at all. The raging monster pounces on the nice pony and tears it apart. GAME OVER.
The pony boldly runs forward, and the dragon elegantly tears it apart. GAME OVER.
From the corner of the screen you see a beautiful pony running across the lawn. You are surprised to note how realistic the image is. Suddenly a fence appears in front! What to do?!
The pony opens its mouth and from it flows a laser stream directly into the fence! However, the fence remains whole and the pony, crashing into it, falls dead. GAME OVER.
The pony confidently accelerates, kicking its legs faster, and with great force, crashes its head into the fence. After this blow, it falls dead to the ground. GAME OVER.
The pony makes a magnificent and, landing, continues to run forward. Now in front of you there is a huge bat!
The pony jumps straight into the bat, and it bites the pony. You see how the pony weakens after the bite and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony accelerates, kicking its feet faster, but the bat catches up and bites its back leg. After a bite, the pony weakens and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony opens its mouth and a laser stream flows from there! It burns the bat to the ground and continues running. Ahead you see a swamp. What to do?!
The pony jumps right into the swamp and helplessly gets stuck in it. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out, and looks sadly into your eyes. GAME OVER.

The pony shoots a laser into the swamp and causes a massive vapor cloud. Unable to see anything, the pony finds itself in a viscous place and helplessly gets stuck. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out, and looks sadly into your eyes. GAME OVER.
The pony swiftly runs through the swamp and overcomes the obstacle with a smile. Ahead — a huge fire-breathing dragon! What to do?!

The pony jumps right into the dragon! The monster is extremely surprised and, not expecting this turn of events, gets its claws in front of its eyes. Smiling, the pony runs forward, while the furious dragon blindly burns the clearing behind it.
The pony shoots a laser at the dragon, but the laser is reflected off the shiny scales into the sky. The raging monster pounces on the nice pony and tears it apart. GAME OVER.
The pony boldly runs forward, but doesn't have time to slip between the dragon's legs, and the dragon tears the pony apart. GAME OVER.
From the corner of the screen you see a beautiful pony running across the lawn. On the back of pony you a powerful laser installation. Suddenly a fence appears in front! What to do?!
The pony struggles to jump over the fence, but the installation on its back is too heavy. It runs into the fence and gets stuck in it. GAME OVER.
The pony tries to accelerate, but the laser setup is too heavy. It crashes into the fence and after the impact it falls dead to the ground. GAME OVER.
The laser setup on the pony's back makes a volley and there's not a trace left of the gate. The pony joyfully runs forward. Now in front of you there's a huge bat!

The pony tries to jump, but, because of the weight of the laser setup on its back, it lands back down on the ground, breaking all four of its legs. The bat is drinking the blood of the helpless pony and it can't even move. GAME OVER.
The pony is trying to escape with the heavy laser setup on its back, but the bat catches up and bites its back leg. After a bite, pony quickly weakens and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony activates its laser unit and burns the bat to dust, continuing its run. Ahead you see a swamp. What to do?!
The pony awkwardly jumps right into the swamp and quickly sinks to the bottom along with the laser installation. GAME OVER.
The pony shoots a laser into the swamp and causes a massive vapor cloud. Unable to see anything, it helplessly gets stuck and quicklu sink to the bottom along with the laser installation. GAME OVER.
The pony tries to cross the swamp, but gets into a viscous part of it, helplessly getting stuck and quickly sinking to bottom along with the laser installation. GAME OVER.
The pony activates the laser unit and burns the bat to dust, continuing its run. Ahead you see a huge dragon! What to do?!
The pony awkwardly jumps and under the weight of the installation, breaks all four of its legs! The dragon is extremely surprised, but still eats the unlucky pony. GAME OVER.
The pony shoots at the dragon and burns a huge hole through it. The monster falls dead, and the pony joyfully runs forward!

The pony boldly runs forwards, but doesn't have time to slip between the dragon's legs, and the dragon tears it apart. And although the subatomic explosion from the laser unit kills the dragon, that doesn't make it any easier for you - you can't bring the pony back. GAME OVER.

From the corner of the screen you see a beautiful pony running across the lawn. You notice that the image periodically freezes and twitches, and the background is filled with graphics artifacts. Suddenly a fence appears in front! What to do?!
The pony jumps up and hangs in the air. The fence remains behind, but the pony is still flying in the air ahead and nothing else happens. It seems that the slot machine jammed.

choice.text: Hit the slot machine with some other body part.
Get away from the slot machine.

event.text: The pony opens its mouth, and a laser stream flows straight into the fence! The fence turns into a cluster of hieroglyphs and the pony runs through it without harm.
The pony successfully runs through the fence without breaking it.
Now in front of you there is a huge bat!
The pony jumps right at the bat, but suddenly it turns into a fence, and the pony gets stuck in the air. GAME OVER.
The pony opens its mouth and a laser stream flows from there! It burns the bat to the ground and continues running. Ahead is an absolutely smooth field. What to do now?!
The pony jumps and, landing, gets stuck in the textures of the field. A minute later, instead of the field, a swamp is loaded. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out. GAME OVER.

The pony shoots the laser somewhere beyond the horizon with no apparent effect. Suddenly it stops in place. A minute later, instead of the field, a swamp is loaded. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out. GAME OVER.

The pony accelerates, kicking faster. The bat, because of a lack of memory on the part of the slot machine, stops moving and doesn't catch up with the pony. Ahead is an absolutely smooth field. What to do now?!
The pony jumps and, landing, gets stuck in the textures of the field. A minute later, a swamp is loaded. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out. GAME OVER.

The pony shoots the laser somewhere beyond the horizon with no apparent effect. Suddenly it stops in place. A minute later, instead of the field, a swamp is loaded. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out. GAME OVER.
The pony rapidly runs forward. The absence of obstacles makes it very happy. Ahead — a huge fire-breathing dragon! And more precisely, it's only its head hanging in the air. What to do?!
The pony jumps right on the dragon's head and the slot machine's screen freezes...

choice.text: Get away from the slot machine.

event.text: The pony shoots at the dragon, and the dragon fires its breath at the pony. As soon as the two streams touch, the screen explodes, and smoke comes out of the slot machine.
The pony boldly runs forward, and the dragon's head incinerates the lawn behind it. The dragon clearly can't turn its head in time to hit the pony.
From the corner of the screen you see a beautiful pony, running through a gloomy cemetery. Suddenly a fence appears appears in front! What to do?!
The pony opens its mouth and from it flows a laser stream directly into the fence! However, the fence remains whole and the pony, crashing into it, falls dead. GAME OVER.
The pony confidently accelerates, kicking its legs faster, and with great force, crashes its head into the fence. After this blow, it falls dead to the ground. GAME OVER.
The pony frowns and goes to ram! From a blow to the fence, the pony falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony tries to make a slide tackle under the fence, but gets stuck between the lower bars. GAME OVER.
The pony makes a magnificent jump and, landing, continues to run forward. Now you see a huge mirror ahead!
The pony somehow jumps awkwardly into the mirror and the pony splits in two. They don't run very far apart from each other for a very long time, and then "GAME OVER" appears on the screen.
The pony opens its mouth and from it flows a laser stream directly into the mirror! The reflected beam burns the pony into dust. GAME OVER.
The pony tries to make a slide tackle, but only 50% of the ponny slips under the sharp mirror. GAME OVER.
The pony accelerates, and a powerful body slam breaks the mirror without any harm and the pony races on! Ahead you see a huge stone golem! What to do?!
The pony opens its mouth and burns the stone golem with a laser beam! It doesn't exactly do any harm, and the golem flattens the pony with its huge hand. GAME OVER.
The pony accelerates its running, but with a powerful kick, the golem sends the pony into flight over the horizon. GAME OVER.
The pony pulls itself together and rams the golem with a strong blow from its head. While pony skulls are famous for their special strength, in this case the stone golem wins. GAME OVER.
The pony tries to make a slide tackle, but the golem dextrously flattens it with its giant foot. GAME OVER.
With a deceptive jump, the pony dodges a blow from the stone golem and runs onwards. Ahead is an ice cave covered with stalactites!
The pony jumps and gets impaled on one of the stalactites hanging from the ceiling. GAME OVER.
The pony opens its mouth and burns the ice cave with a laser beam. From this, the cave's ceiling melts and drowns the pony with a flood.
The pony accelerates its running. From the loud clatter of its hooves, the stalactites begin to fall, one after the another, and crush the poor pony! GAME OVER.
The pony pulls itself together and strikes several stalactites with a powerful blow! From the vibration, the cave's ceiling collapses and falls on the pony. GAME OVER.
The pony makes an elegant slide tackle on the icy floor of the cave and comes out the other side. There are 5 doors ahead, and you cannot see what's behind them! In which one should the pony run?!
Behind the door there are 4 more doors, and again you can't see what's hidden behind them! In which one should the pony run?!
Behind the door there are 3 more doors, and again you can't see what's hidden behind them! In which one should the pony run?!
Behind the door is a beautiful meadow with flowers and butterflies. The pony is very pleased with you, however, a giant fire-breathing dragon appears ahead! What to do now?!
The pony jumps right into the dragon's mouth. The monster is extremely surprised, but chews and swallows this gift of fate. GAME OVER.
The pony shoots a laser into the dragon, but it doesn't burn its scales at all. The raging monster pounces on the nice pony and tears it apart. GAME OVER.
The pony boldly runs forward, and the dragon skillfully tears it apart. GAME OVER.
The pony pulls itself together and strikes the strongest blow it can muster between the dragon's legs, pacifying the dragon. Seems you were lucky this time!
The pony manages to slide imperceptibly underneath the dragon. Seems you were lucky this time!
A beautiful pony is shown from the corner of the screen. Its runs along the lawn and the sun shines on its golden mane. Suddenly a fence appears in front! What to do?!
The pony opens its mouth and from it flows a laser stream directly into the fence! However, the fence remains whole and the pony, crashing into it, falls dead. GAME OVER.
The pony confidently accelerates, kicking its legs faster, and with great force, crashes its head into the fence. After this blow, it falls dead to the ground. GAME OVER.
The pony covers itself with a layer of thorns and slams headlong into the fence with force. After this blow, it falls dead on the ground. GAME OVER.
The pony makes a magnificent and, landing, continues to run forward. Now in front of you there is a huge bat!
The pony jumps straight into the bat, and it bites the pony. You see how the pony weakens after the bit and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony accelerates, kicking its feet faster, but the bat catches up and bites its back leg. After a bite, the pony weakens and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony covers iself with a layer of thorns. After a bite, the pony weakens and falls to the ground dead. GAME OVER.
The pony opens its mouth and a laser stream flows from there! It burns the bat to the ground and continues running. Ahead you see a swamp. What to do?!
The pony jumps right into the swamp and helplessly gets stuck in it. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out, and looks sadly into your eyes. GAME OVER.

The pony shoots a laser into the swamp and causes a massive vapor cloud. Unable to see anything, the pony finds itself in a viscous place and helplessly gets stuck. The pony is still alive, but cannot get out, and looks sadly into your eyes. GAME OVER.
The pony covers itself with a layer of thorns, however, it falls into a viscous part of the swamp and helplessly gets stuck. GAME OVER.
The pony swiftly runs through the swamp and overcomes the obstacle with a smile. Ahead — a huge fire-breathing dragon! What to do?!
The pony jumps right into the dragon's mouth. The monster is extremely surprised, but chews and swallows this gift of fate. GAME OVER.
The pony shoots a laser into the dragon, but it doesn't burn its scales at all. The raging monster pounces on the nice pony and tears it apart. GAME OVER.
The pony boldly runs forward, and the dragon elegantly tears it apart. GAME OVER.
The pony covers itself with a layer of thorns, however, the dragon incinerates it with its fiery breath. GAME OVER.
A beautiful pony is shown from the corner of the screen. It runs across the lawn and the sun shines on its golden mane. Suddenly a fence appears in front! What to do?!
You trust the pony, and it doesn't fail you. It makes a magnificent leap through the gate and, landing, continues to run forward. Now in front of you there is a huge bat!
You trust the pony, and it doesn't fail you. It makes a magnificent leap through the gate and, landing, continues to run forward. Now in front of you there is a huge bat!
The pony stands in hesitation behind the fence, and then runs off the screen. GAME OVER.
The pony opens its mouth and a laser stream flows from there! It burns the bat to the ground and continues running. Ahead you see a swamp. What to do?!
The pony opens its mouth and a laser stream flows from there! It burns the bat to the ground and continues running. Ahead you see a swamp. What to do?!
Seeing the bat, the pony tries to pretend to be dead. After a bite, it doesn't have to pretend anymore. GAME OVER.
The pony swiftly runs through the swamp and overcomes the obstacle with a smile. Ahead — a huge fire-breathing dragon! What to do?!
The pony swiftly runs through the swamp and overcomes the obstacle with a smile. Ahead — a huge fire-breathing dragon! What to do?!
The pony jumps right into the swamp, and joyfully tramples its hooves until it disappears into the abyss. GAME OVER.

The pony makes the only right decision — it doesn't look at the dragon's eyes and instead runs around the dragon, making overgrown goat tracks, distracting the dragon long enough for the pony to run right past it.

The pony makes the only right decision — it doesn't look at the dragon's eyes and instead runs around the dragon, making overgrown goat tracks, distracting the dragon long enough for the pony to run right past it.
Filled with determination, the pony runs right into the dragon's mouth... GAME OVER.

event.name: SLURM_BOSS_EVENT
event.text: You come across an unusual Slig ship built on the back of a giant Slug. It is armed no less strangely, but nevertheless it doesn't hurry to attack you. You try to hail them, but the Sligs don't respond.
Easily dodging your attack, they finally pay attention to you. "You'll regret that, you miserable creaturesss."
You wait for a while, but the Sligs continue to ignore you.
Easily dodging your attack, they finally pay attention to you. "You'll regret that, you miserable creaturesss."
You don't risk contacting the unknown ship. Your mission is paramount.
The Sligs begin loading containers with Slurm in them into a small shuttle. One of the barrels wasn't secured properly, and it loosens away from the rest, slowly floating towards you.
Now the Sligs finally pay attention to you. "That doess not belong to you, and you will be punished for your insssolence!"

choice.text: Don't touch it, just fly away from here.

event.text: You don't risk contacting the unknown ship. Your mission is paramount.

destroyed.text: The ship explodes into pieces, and you grab everything that survives. The corpse of the Queen floats among the wreckage...

event.text: You also find a unique weapon in the wreckage.

deadCrew.text: With all the Slurms dead, you search the ship and find a barrel of Slurm. The Queen furiously squelches in her room, but she can't do anything. You turn off its life-support system so it won't harm anyone else.

event.text: You also find a unique weapon aboard the ship.

event.name: PEACEFUL_MAN_EVENT
event.text: Near the beacon, you notice a ship, and its owner hails you...
..."Give me these materials immediately and no one gets hurt!"
You understand that this is the only way to suvive now, and send the blackmailer the resources.
The blackmailer does not follow you, but switches to some other ship near the beacon.
..."I'll buy fuel! Very expensive! Just agree, don't think! "
You drain the fuel and take the payment.
..."We are conducting research here, and we really need materials. Helping me isn't hard for you!
You send them the resources. The captain of the ship thanks you and is about to fly away.

choice.text: Wish him good luck on the road.

event.text: "Thanks! And the same for you!"

choice.text: Charge up the weapons and set off in pursuit.

event.text: You decide that altruism in war conditions is too much luxury, and the chase begins.

choice.text: Charge your FTL Drive and then fly away.

event.text: ..."Buy a lottery ticket! The chance of winning is about 50 percent! Test your luck, pilot!"
You give him the scrap and start erasing the fields of a lottery ticket...
..."Hi, pilot, let's have a drink! I'm all alone here, I'm stuck at this beacon, and I don't even have anyone with which to drink rum with."
"Well, you're boring, I'll find someone more fun..."
The entire crew drink with your new friend and share interesting stores. After drinking, he gives you some resources and wishes you a successful journey.
The entire crew drink with your new friend and share interesting stores. After drinking, he gives you some resources and wishes you a successful journey.
The entire crew drink with your new friend and share interesting stores. After drinking, it turns out that you're left with an empty fuel tank! And your new "friend" is trying to escape!
The entire crew drink with your new friend and share interesting stores. During the drinking you also learn from him information about the surrounding beacons.
The entire crew drink with your new friend and share interesting stores. After drinking, he gives you a weapon and wishes you a successful journey.

The entire crew drink with your new friend and share interesting stores. During the drinking bout, a brawl erupts, and one of your crew members is shot through the head! And your new "friend" is trying to escape!
Your crew member will be missed.

removeCrew.text: You go to the clonebay with hope, and to your relief, the clone of the lost crew member is already up and about.

event.text: Since your ship is solely under AI control, you needn't fear the death of any crew.
Seeing your intentions, he says: "Okay, okay, stop! Let's talk. Here's a modest offer.. at these coordinates you'll find the richest abandoned warehouse. See you there?!"
You enter the beacon's coordinates on the sector map and get ready to jump.
Seeing your intentions, he says: "Okay, okay, stop! Let's talk. Here's a modest offer.. I have an interesting weapon — will you take it?"
You take the weapon and release the pirate's ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug knows what he wants to offer you.

event.text: You take the weapon and release the pirate's ship.
Seeing your intentions, he says: "Okay, okay, stop! Let's talk. I have an unusual device... Will you take it and let us both part ways in peace?"
You take the strange device and release the pirate's ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug knows what he wants to offer you.

event.text: You take the strange device and release the pirate's ship.
Seeing your intentions, he says: "Okay, okay, stop! Let's talk. Here's a modest offer.. take my slave?"
You take the slave and release the pirate ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug knows who he wants to offer you.

event.text: You take the slave and release the pirate ship.
Seeing your intentions, he says: "Okay, okay, stop! Let's talk. Here's a modest offer.. Will you take my ship augment and let us both part ways in peace?"
You take the augmentation and release the pirate's ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug knows what augment he wants to offer you.

event.text: You take the augmentation and release the pirate's ship.
...it's a losing ticket. The lottery operator says: "Don't be upset, you'll be lucky next time, pilot!"
...it's a losing ticket. The lottery operator says: "Don't be upset, you'll be lucky next time, pilot!"
...it's a losing ticket. The lottery operator says: "Don't be upset, you'll be lucky next time, pilot!"
...it's a winning ticket. The lottery operator says: "What luck, here's the reward!"
...it's a winning ticket. The lottery operator says: "What luck, here's the reward!"
...it's a winning ticket. The lottery operator says: "What luck, here's the reward!"
Hearing your words, he apologizes and says that he only has this...
Hearing your words, he apologizes and says that he only has this...
Hearing your words, he apologizes and says that he has no way to thank you in that manner.
The blackmailer flies away, and you assess your losses...
The blackmailer suddenly hails again: "I was thinking... I don't need this anymore..." — he drops off some weapon in the direction of your ship!
"Hey! Well, what are you doing?! Okay okay, I get it! I have the coordinates of the wormhole to the world of Crystals! We'll meet there?!"
You enter the coordinates on the sector map and prepare to jump.
You still continue charging the weapons.. and now the enemy is doing the same.
"Hey! Well, what are you doing?! Okay okay, I get it! I have a great repair kit! Will you take it?!"
You still continue charging the weapons.. and now the enemy is doing the same.
"Hey! Well, what are you doing?! Okay okay, I get it! I know of a place nearby where you can get tons of scrap! Shall we fly?!"
You still continue charging the weapons.. and now the enemy is doing the same.
"Hey! Well, what are you doing?! Okay okay, I get it! Maybe you'll take a drone and forget everything!?"
You take the drone and release the pirate ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug knows what kind of drone he wants to offer you.

event.text: You take the drone and release the pirate ship.
You still continue charging the weapons.. and now the enemy is doing the same.
You fly behind the ship and find yourself in a dense asteroid field. Suddenly the ship guiding you fires a volley at you, but misses!
You fly behind the ship and find yourself in a dense asteroid field. The ship guiding you begins to gently cut asteroids containing iron ore.

choice.text: Wait until he himself does everything. Monitor his actions from afar.

event.text: The pirate mines a bit of ore and gives you some for protecting him.

choice.text: Attack him while you have the chance.

event.text: You start charging the weapons. A vulnerable opponent — what could be better!
When you approach and enthusiastically process asteroids, you hear and feel a shot directly into your ship's side! Insidious deceiver!
Together, you extract the necessary materials and, after processing them, load everything into the holds.
Instead of a box with a repair kit on your ship, there's a warhead with a detonator. A terrible explosion rocks the ship, and the pirate begins to attack you.
You repair a bit of damage to the ship's hull.
You repair some damage to the ship's hull.
The pirate didn't come here, but at the indicated coordinates you find a wormhole! Surely it leads to the Crystal sector.
You decide that approaching the wormhole is too dangerous for the ship...
At these coordinates you find a warehouse full of useful equipment. Evidently pirates have never been here, so you calmly clean out the warehouse.

escape.text: The ship begins charging its FTL Drive!

gotaway.text: The ship made an FTL jump.

event.name: ZOLTAN_BLINK_EVENT
event.text: From the surface of the planet near the beacon you intercept a transmission: "Somebody help! Spare us from it! It's unbearable!"

choice.text: Move in closer and find out what's going on.

event.text: You go out into a low planetary orbit and notice a glowing ball flying at high speed over peaceful settlements. Suddenly it begins to approach your ship!

choice.text: Move in closer and find out what's going on.

event.text: You go out into a low planetary orbit and notice a glowing ball flying at high speed over peaceful settlements. Suddenly it begins to approach your ship!

escape.text: It seems that the glowing sphere is retreating!

gotaway.text: The glowing sphere disappeared in an unknown direction. You contact the planetary settlements...

destroyed.text: The glowing ball is destroyed. You contact the planetary settlements...

escape.text: It seems that the glowing sphere is retreating!

gotaway.text: The glowing sphere disappeared in an unknown direction. You contact the planetary settlements...

destroyed.text: The sphere's glowing fragments crash into your ship, and you notice that the reactor is producing more energy. You contact the planetary settlements...

event.text: ...and in gratitude the locals give you some of what's left of their supplies.
...and the locals thank you with their supplies.
...and the locals thank you with their supplies.
...and in gratitude the locals share a map of the sector with you as well as a portion of their scrap reserves.
...and in gratitude the locals patch up your ship's hull.

textList.name: NEBULA_SLURM_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: Usually, Sligs don't attack first, but not this time... Seems that something scared them in this nebula.
An aggressive Slig ship appears out of another nebula, and it ignores all your attempts to establish contact.
You almost collide with the hull of a Slig ship, which suddenly appeared out of nowhere near the beacon in this nebula. They frightenedly start firing at you, ignoring all communication attempts.

The nebula around you is very dense. Suddenly, right in front of the stern a Slig ship appears, and you lightly scratch their plating. "You will pay for thiss, aliensss." Looks like you angered them...

The nebula around you is very dense. Suddenly, right in front of the stern a Slig ship appears, and you lightly scratch their plating. You try to explain it was an accident, but they're already preparing to punish you.
You stumble upon some Sligs cooking Slurm. After seeing you, they send an angry message: "Ssspiess! You'll never find out our recipe!" Seems that a battle is unavoidable.

You seem to have interrupted a Slig ship engaged in preparing Slurm within this nebula. Sligs don't like being distracted from this 'important' profession of theirs. The weapon array aimed at you clearly hints at that.

textList.name: SLURM_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: You appear in the midst of a battle between a Slig ship and a Mantis ship, when the Mantis suddenly make a hasty retreat. The Sligs take you for the Mantis' reinforcements and don't even bother hailing.
Although the Sligs are known as a peace-loving faction, gangsters are sometimes found among them. You meet one such ship at this beacon.
The Sligs rarely attack first, but not this time. Weapons to battle!

You stumble upon a Slig engaged in cooking Slurm. After seeing you, they send an angry message: "Because of your sssudden appearance, we made a missstake in the recipe! So many resources have been wassted! You'll pay for that!" They attack.
You stumble upon a Slig engaged in cooking Slurm. After seeing you, they send an angry message: "Ssspiess! You'll never learn our sssecret recipe." Looks like a battle can't be avoided.

It seems that you disturbed a Slig ship engaged in preparing Slurm. The Sligs don't like to be distracted from this 'important job' of theirs. The weapon array aimed at you clearly gives some hint of that.

event.text: Don't touch the Sligs unless they touch you. Time to fly away.

textList.name: SLURM_ATTACK_TEXT
textList.text: You don't want to miss this chance to get hold of the Slurm. Attack!
Вам ОЧЕНЬ нужен слёрм, время применить грубую силу!
Ничего личного, но нам нужен весь ваш слёрм!
Вы отдаёте приказ атаковать их, слёрмы защищаются.
Вы не можете спокойно пролететь мимо корабля слёрмов... Нужно захватить их зелье!
Вы бы пролетели мимо, если бы не слёрм... Нужно срочно достать хотя бы самую маленькую бочку.

textList.name: NEUTRAL_SLURM_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: You encounter a Slig ship, engaged as always in brewing Slurm. They pay no attention to you.
While no one threatens the Sligs, nothing can distract them from cooking Slurm. Such a situation is happening right this moment...
You meet a Slig ship hurrying about their business. You try to hail, but they ignore you.
The Slig ship is busy cleaning the surroundings of the beacon. Empty plastic Slurm containers drift everywhere. No one pays any attention to you.
The Slig ship nearby isn't hostile, but they don't react to your attempts to contact them. Probably, they are busy cooking Slurm.
You appear right next to a Slig ship and lightly scratch their plating. You send a message apologizing, but it goes unanswered...

event.text: Don't touch the Sligs unless they touch you. Time to fly away.

textList.name: NEBULA_NEUTRAL_SLURM_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: The nebula before you is very dense, and you almost collide with a Slig ship. Nobody answers your hail.
The outlines of a Slig ship flicker ahead. Who knows what they're up to...
You encounter a Slig ship in this nebula. They must not be interested in you whatsoever since they don't answer your hail.
You come across Sligs in this nebula. As always, they're busy cooking Slurm, and don't react to your appearance.
Among piles of plastic barrels slowly drifts a Slig ship. Another empty container flies out of the airlock of their cargo bay... It's not right to litter!
Flying into this nebula cloud, you come across Sligs. It seems they're up to something...

event.text: The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind a bit of useful equipment.
The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind a bit of useful equipment.
The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind a bit of useful equipment.
The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind a bit of useful equipment.
The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind some useful equipment.
The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind some useful equipment.
The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind a considerable amount of useful equipment.
The Slig ship explodes, leaving behind a bit of scrap. Among the debris you notice a surviving weapon.
You explore the wreckage in search of Slurm, but no container survived in battle...
You explore the wreckage in search of Slurm and find one surviving barrel. Since it's only of any value if the Slurm inside fermented, it's necessary to take a look and check if it's ready.
You explore the wreckage in search of Slurm and find one surviving barrel. Since it's only of any value if the Slurm inside fermented, it's necessary to take a look and check if it's ready.
The Slurm in the barrel is completely ready for use, so you carefully reseal the container. Merchants will pay a good price for it.
The Slurm in the barrel is completely ready for use, so you carefully reseal the container. Merchants will pay a good price for it.
The Slurm in the barrel is completely ready for use, so you carefully reseal the container. Merchants will pay a good price for it.
The Slurm in the barrel is completely ready for use, so you carefully reseal the container. Merchants will pay a good price for it.
This kind of Slurm was cooked from fuel cells, but the Slurm didn't have time to ferment. You recycle what you can from the barrel.
This kind of Slurm was cooked from drone parts, but the Slurm didn't have time to ferment. You recycle what you can from the barrel.
This kind of Slurm was cooked from missile ammunition, but the Slurm didn't have time to ferment. You recycle what you can from the barrel.
This kind of Slurm was brewed from metal, but the Slurm didn't have time to ferment. You recycle what scrap you can from the barrel.

By some miracle, you managed to kill all the Sligs... Time to plunder! You explore the holds in search of Slurm and find one surviving barrel. Since it's only of any value if the Slurm inside fermented, it's necessary to take a look and check if it's ready.
By some miracle, you managed to kill all the Sligs... Time to plunder! You explore the holds in search of Slurm, but find only a surviving weapon. You're not complaining though...
You rush into the battle, confident of your speedy victory.

choice.text: Wait until the battle is over, then attack the surviving ship.

event.text: The battle's outcome was obvious. As soon as the Slig ship explodes, you attack the Mantis, not letting them collect the debris.
You're not in a position right now to interfere in extraneous skirmishes. Hiding, you make a jump.

textList.name: DISTRESS_SLURM_MANTIS_TEXT
textList.text: The distress signal was transmitted by a Slig ship under Mantis attack... very soon only debris will be left of them.
The Sligs sent a desperate distress signal — they're being attacked by the Mantis. There isn't even a single scratch on the Mantis ship, but the Slig ship is riddled with gaping holes...

destroyed.text: The Mantis ship breaks apart.

deadCrew.text: All the Mantis are dead.

event.text: The Sligs are grateful you saved them and in return offer one of their weapons.
The Sligs are grateful you saved them and in return give you a barrel of Slurm.
The fire reached their clonebay, and there are no survivors... You grab all that's left of the Slig ship before moving on.

destroyed.text: The Mantis ship breaks apart.

deadCrew.text: All the Mantis are dead.

event.text: You inspect the wreckage and find a surviving Slurm barrel. Since it's only of any value if the Slurm inside fermented, it's necessary to take a look and check if it's ready.
The Sligs were carrying a bunch of useful equipment. You grab all that's left of it.
The Sligs were transporting some useful equipment. You grab all that's left of it.

event.name: NEBULA_SLURM_PLANET_TRADER
event.text: The Sligs at this beacon ask you for one of your crewmembers, from which to cook a special Slurm composition. For this they promise to give you 50 scrap and a Slurm sample. The entire crew is clearly against this, but it's up to you...
The Sligs immediately react to your aggression.
After refusing them, the Sligs quickly lose any and all interest in your crew, to your crew's relief.

event.name: SLURM_PLANET_TRADER
event.text: Near the beacon, a planetary trading network is broadcasting on general communication channels...

textList.name: GONE_TO_SPACE_TEXT
textList.text: You lure the crew member into the airlock bay and abruptly open the airlock. The air pressure blows them out into open space...
With the whole crew, you grab the crew member and throw them out into open space...
After tying up a member of your crew, you jettison them out into open space...
After stunning the crew member, you jettison them out into open space...
Inconspiciously injecting a paralyzing compund into the crew member, you quietly throw them out into open space...
You give your crew member a high dose of LSD, and after waiting until they don't understand anything at all, you throw them out of an open airlock...
After asking the crew member to inspect the outer plating, you power up the engines, leaving them to dangle in outer space...

event.text: ...Of these messages, you understand that bringing Humans to their planet is forbidden. What to do?
You decide not to endanger your crew and the mission to save the Federation.

choice.text: Set a course to land on the spaceport of the trading network.

event.text: You successfully land, and go out to the trade platform.

choice.text: Set a course to land on the spaceport of the trading network.

event.name: SLURM_4_BARRELS
event.text: Nearby there's a Slig ship. They ask you to sell a lot of Slurm in the shopping mall nearby. What do you say, Captain?
You start loading the Slurm into the ship...
...the Sligs drag another barrel in...
...and then one more. You wonder if the hold will fit all of this...
...finally, they drag in the last barrel. You thank them for their trust and promise to deliver the goods as soon as possible. They give you the destination's coordinates.
The Sligs immediately begin charging their weapons in response.
After declining, the Slurms continue to go about their business, not paying any attention to you.
At the coordinates indicated by the Sligs you find the store. Time to unload the cargo!
You go to the coordinates specified by the Sligs but don't find a shop. There's absolutely nothing interesting near the beacon. Looks like they gave you the wrong coordinates.

event.name: SLURM_3_CORPORATIONS
event.text: On the planet nearby are 3 competing corporations that manufacture weapons from scrap. There's a fee to enter each factory.
You pay the entrace fee and are then taken to the plant's workshop...
The Sligs show weapons they can make for you right now. Interested in any of them?
You pay for the weapon's production and some time later you take the finished product.
You pay for the weapon's production and some time later you take the finished product.
You pay for the weapon's production and some time later you take the finished product.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Your Slug suggests that weapons will be cheaper where the entrance ticket is more expensive...

event.text: Are you a cheater?

choice.text: Charge the FTL engines and fly away.

textList.text: Enter the "Sticky Forceps" factory.
Enter the "Jelly Technology" factory.
Enter the "Smelly Cannon" factory.
Enter the "Squelching Sledgehammer" factory.

Enter the "Liquid Nails" factory.
Enter the "Galactic Devil" factory.
Enter the "Soft Tinkerers" factory.

textList.text: Enter the "Slimy Masters" factory.
Enter the "Sticky Brigade" factory.
Enter the "Slocknog Technologies" factory.
Enter the "Slokruk Welders" factory.

event.name: NEBULA_SLURM_CRAZY_CAPTAIN
event.text: The ship near the beacon hails: "Our captain drank cheap Ssslurm, and isss now drunk beyond measure, closing hisss cabin and sssinging loudly! Every time we try and reassson with him, he firess hisss persssonal blasster... And we have an important transssport mission from the Queen! Can you help usss?"

choice.text: Send the crew to the Slig ship to bring the captain back to his senses.
(Mind Control) Interfere with the captain's mind.
(Improved Mind Control) Interfere with the captain's mind.
(Advanced Mind Control) Interfere with the captain's mind.

event.text: The drunken Slig captain gives the order to defend his ship!

choice.text: Refuse to intervene, charge the FTL engines and fly away.

event.text: Your crew deftly neutralizes the drunken captain, and the other Sligs in gratitude give you some of their supplies.
Your crew deftly neutralizes the drunken captain, and the other Sligs in gratitude give you some of their supplies.

Your crew tries to neutralize the drunken captain, but in the shootout one of your crewmembers is fatally wounded. Still, they manage to tie up the captain, and the other Sligs in gratitude give you some of their supplies.

removeCrew.text: A new crewmember appears in the ship's Clone Bay.

event.text: Noticing the approach of your crew to his ship, the Sligs' captain in an intoxicated state gives the order to open fire! No one dares argue with him...
Due to strong intoxication, the captain cannot resist the mind control and soon calms down. The rest of the Sligs in gratitude give you some of their supplies.
Noticing the unsuccessful attempts of your mind control system, the Sligs' captain in an intoxicated state gives the order to open fire! No one dares argue with him...

Noticing the unsuccessful attempts of your mind control system, the Sligs' captain in an intoxicated state gives the order to open fire! No one dares argue with him...
A few shots, and you manage to stun the drunken captain. The rest of the Sligs, having tied him up, give you some of their supplies in gratitude.
A few shots, and you manage to stun the drunken captain. The rest of the Sligs, having tied him up, give you some of their supplies in gratitude.
A few shots, and you manage to stun the drunken captain. The rest of the Sligs, having tied him up, give you some of their supplies in gratitude.
Noticing your shots, the Sligs' captain in an intoxicated state gives the order to open fire in response! No one dares argue with him...

event.name: NEBULA_SLURM_PIRATE_STEAL
event.text: The pirate ship hails: "We've stolen a lot of Slurm from the stupid Sligs. Take this and forget we ever met. Deal?"
You take the bribe, and the pirate prepares to go about their business.
Pirates should be punished for their illegal actions. You fire up the weapon array.

escape.text: Looks like the pirates are trying to get away!

gotaway.text: The ship made an FTL jump...

destroyed.text: After destroying the ship, you collect all that survived...

event.text: ...and also manage to find a canister of Slurm!

deadCrew.text: After ridding the ship of crew, you collect all that survived...

event.text: ...and also manage to find a canister of Slurm!

event.name: NEBULA_SLURM_RECEPT
event.text: A nearby Slig ship asks you for help: "My brother livesss at a nearby beacon, and it isss of utmossst importance to give him the recipe for my new Ssslurm liqueur! Will you take thisss job?"
The Slig sees your aggression and reacts accordingly.
You decide that now is not the best time for business like this.

event.name: SLURM_RECEPT_GOOD_SLURM
event.text: The Slig tastes the resulting mixture. The resulting Slurm is magnificent, and the owner of the station grants you some of his supplies in gratitude.
He also gives you a fresh batch of canned Slurm.

textList.name: SLURM_RECEPT_TEXT1
textList.text: "...hmm, that's curiousss. And what elssse did my brother sssay?..."
"...hmm, I sssupposse... What elssse did he sssay?..."
"...I knew it! Come on, quickly! What elssse?..."

textList.name: SLURM_RECEPT_TEXT2
textList.text: "...I would never have guesssed. What will be the lasst ingredient in my cauldron?!"
"...you're laughing? It certainly will not work... sso what'ss the lassst thing? "
"...lasst time I burned down the wallss because of a sssimilar recipe ... so what's lasst?"
"...I have thisss bad feeling that you are missstaken ... what elssse?"

textList.name: SLURM_RECEPT_TEXT3
textList.text: When the last ingredient is added, the boiler explodes, coating the walls of the room with the Slig's insides. You, having miraculously survived, get away from the station.

While adding the last ingredient, the boiler begins to boil violently. The Slig turns off the heating in time, but the resulting mixture clearly isn't Slurm. You try to get out of the station as soon as possible.

While adding the last ingredient, the pot begins to stink unbearably. The Slig turns off the heating, but the resulting mixture clearly isn't Slurm. You try to get out of the station as soon as you possible.
When the last ingredient is added, the boiler explodes. The Slig goes into a rage with his equipment destroyed, and in the meantime, you quicky get out of the station.

event.text: "Fantassstic... Tell him to add the following to the sssolution: Ssslug fat, Human sssecretionss and a A Zoltan's liver. My brother livess at these coordinatesss." You mark the location of the "nearby" beacon...

"Fantassstic... Tell him to add the following to the sssolution: the eye of a Zoltan, a fuel cell and sssome charred metal. My brother livess at these coordinatesss." You mark the location of the "nearby" beacon...

"Fantassstic... Tell him to add the following to the sssolution: the heart of a Cryssstal, drone tonic and sssome Ssslug ssskin. My brother livess at these coordinatesss." You mark the location of the "nearby" beacon...

"Fantassstic... Tell him to add the following to the sssolution: an AI Avatar module, the leg of a Mantisss and sssome Ssslug gel. My brother livess at these coordinatesss." You mark the location of the "nearby" beacon...

event.name: NEBULA_EVENT_SLURM_BOARDING
event.text: A Slig ship asks for help. They complain to you about the lack of some ingredients for cooking Slurm and ask of you to capture several ships of other races: "Do you agree, Captain? We're not being greedy today! Just don't blow them up, we need intact biological material..."
"Hurry, the Ssslurm is cooling down!" You enter the coordinates of the first target on the sector map.
The Sligs immediately react to your aggression.
After declining, the Sligs quickly lose all interest in your ship.
At the specified coordinates you find the first target and rush to capture it.

escape.text: Looks like this ship is getting ready to jump!

gotaway.text: The ship made an FTL jump, and the Sligs dissolve your agreement.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart... You collect what's left of it, but the Sligs are extremely unhappy with the fact that during the explosion, the required biological material was lost. They refuse to continue cooperating with you.

deadCrew.text: You manage to capture the ship. While you're collecting everything of value, the Sligs ship the surviving biological material for the Slurm to their ship and give you the coordinates of the next target.

At the specified coordinates you find the sixth target and rush to capture it.
At the specified coordinates you find the sixth target and rush to capture it.
At the specified coordinates you find the sixth target and rush to capture it.
At the specified coordinates you find the sixth target and rush to capture it.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart... You collect what's left of it, but the Sligs are extremely unhappy with the fact that during the explosion, the required biological material was lost. They refuse to continue cooperating with you.

deadCrew.text: You manage to capture the ship. While you're collecting everything of value, the Sligs ship the surviving biological material for the Slurm to their ship.

event.text: As a token of gratitude, the Sligs sputter mucus in all directions and throw a barrel of fermented Slurm towards you. "Thank you, thank you ssso very much, now we can finally finish cooking."

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_TAMOZNA
event.text: Sligs nearby hail: "Hello! A customs inspection follows any flight through this sector, done by the Slig Fleet! Present your documents, Captain!"

choice.text: Give them some your crew's documents.

event.text: The Sligs accept the payment.
The Sligs see your aggression and react accordingly. The nearby planet has already fired its anti-ship cannon, and you don't have time to react!
The Sligs see your attempt and begin an attack. The nearby planet deploys suppressive fire.
"Activate the Anti-Ship battery! We don't have time to deal with every insssolent ssstranger."
"How do you explain this refusal and disobedience to the Slig border authority?"

choice.text: Tell them about your mission to save the Federation.
Talk about the rights of living organisms to move freely in space.
Say that the power of your ship allows you to dictate the laws of any sector.
Say that you lost the documents in a recent confrontation.

event.text: "We're not interested in the Federation'ss problemsss. If there are documents — passssage is free. No documents — we sssearch your ship. Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!"
"We sssee that the sssituation is critical. Take these resssources as help... "
"The races aboard your ship do not refer to reassson enough for the 'privilege' of free movement in ssspace. Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!"
"Alright, Captain, you can continue your flight. Here is information about this sector of ours you can freely move in."
"Are you ssso sure of yourself, Captain?! Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!"
The Sligs fly alongside your ship for a while, and then leave the beacon without risking to attack you.
"Activate the Anti-Ship battery! We don't have time to deal with every insssolent ssstranger."
"...and what do you plan to do now?"

choice.text: We will proceed to Slig headquarters.

event.text: "... Alright, here isss the fuel necessssary for thisss. Be careful."

choice.text: We will go straight to the sector exit.

event.text: "...that'ss incorrect! You know absssolutely nothing about our lawsss. Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!.."
"...that'ss incorrect! You know absssolutely nothing about our lawsss. Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!.."
The Sligs take a long time to review your documents and, finally, declare: "...it ssseemss that all your documentsss are in order. You can continue your flight."
The Sligs take a long time to review your documents and, finally, declare: "...it ssseemss that all your documentsss are in order. However, we mussst alssso examine your hold."
"...Captain, you really ought to be more accommodating in foreign landsss... Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!.."
The Sligs carefully scrutinize your documents and, at last, declare: "...What iss thisss missserable forgery?! Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!.."
"...excellent, all your 'documents' seem to be in order. You can continue your flight."
"...Captain, I think you have too few 'documents'. It is necessary to conduct an additional inspect of your cargo..."
"...Captain, you mussst really be more accommodating in foreign landsss... Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!.."
"...well, your 'documents' seem to be alright. You can continue your flight. Also, according to our rules, you are entitled to the standard armament for protection against 'pests'."
"...well, it seems all your 'documents' are in order. You can continue your flight. Also, according to our rules, you are supposed to be 'escorted'."
The Sligs scour about your hold for a while, and then drag out what they say you will not 'need' in this sector...

choice.text: Try to take them on by force.

event.text: The Sligs see your intentions and answer: "...Captain, you really ought to be more accommodating in foreign landsss... Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!.."
The Sligs scour about your hold for a while, and claim that they must take one of your crewmembers, and will give you fuel as 'compensation'.
The Sligs say: "...Captain, you really ought to be more accommodating in foreign landsss... Activate the Anti-Ship Battery!.."
You take the fuel and give them a member of your crew. Before the crewmember disappears into the Slig ship, they cast a look of contempt at you...
You give your consent, but the Sligs don't find anyone aboard. Perplexed, they release your ship and leave.
The Sligs scour about your hold for a while, and then state "...how in slimy blazes are you going to survive space with those kind of reserves?! Get out of our sight..."
The Sligs scour about your hold for a while, and then state "...how in slimy blazes are you going to survive space with those kind of reserves?! Get out of our sight..."

event.name: EVENT_MANTIS_WRKD
event.text: You find a heavily damaged Mantis ship at this beacon, with a sole Mantis survivor aboard. You try to contact them, but your hails go unanswered.

choice.text: Send the crew to try and persuade them to join your crew.

event.text: You start the attack. This vessel will be easy prey.
You decide not to risk it and instead charge up the FTL Drive.
The Mantis doesn't agree to join your crew and a fierce battle ensues. The Mantis perishes without harm to your crew. You gather everything that's left on board.
The Mantis doesn't agree to join your crew and a fierce battle ensues. The Mantis manages to kill one of your crewmembers before it perishes. Despite this, you clean out the ship.

removeCrew.text: You go to the clonebay with hope, and to your relief, the clone of the lost crewmember is already ready for duty.

event.text: Your crew manages to convince the Mantis to join you, who helps in clearing out what's left of the ship.
Your crew manages to convince the Mantis to join you, who helps in clearing out what's left of the ship.

destroyed.text: The damaged ship breaks apart... You collect all that's left of the ship.

deadCrew.text: You manage to capture the ship, allowing you to gather what's left aboard the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_EVENT_SLURM_RISK
event.text: The Slig ship claims that the boiler they use for cooking Slurm broke down. To start the repairs, you need to dive into it and open the cork at the bottom of the boiler. Slig skin is too soft and slippery for such an operation, so they ask if someone from your crew could hold their breath and do it for them. The Sligs promise to pay well if you're successful.
The Sligs charge their weapons in return.

choice.text: Let them deal with their own problems.

textList.name: EVENT_SLURM_RISK_TEXT
textList.text: As soon as your "helper" climbs into the vat full of Slurm, the Sligs lock it shut and turn on the heating! When this is done, the Sligs start attacking your ship!

textList.name: EVENT_SLURM_RISK_TEXT2
textList.text: Your "assistant" climbs into the vat full of Slurm and successfully does what was required of them. In gratitude you're given a lot of supplies.

event.text: Choose who will help the Sligs.

removeCrew.text: The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.
The clone of the crewmember boiled alive in Slurm emerges from the clonebay ready to seek revenge.

event.text: Choose who will help the Sligs.

Your Slug confidently climbs into the vat full of Slurm and, being at the bottom, starts randomly floundering around and slipping before eventually dissolving... After this, the vat full of Slurm explodes and damages the sensitive equipment. With fury, the Sligs go on the attack!

removeCrew.text: The clone of the Slug asks that you never again force it to do things like that...

event.text: Choose who will help the Sligs.

Your Slug confidently climbs into the vat full of Slurm and, being at the bottom, starts randomly floundering around and slipping before eventually dissolving... After this, the vat full of Slurm explodes and damages the sensitive equipment. With fury, the Sligs go on the attack!

removeCrew.text: The clone of the Slug asks that you never again force it to do things like that...

event.text: Just as you're about to leave, the Sligs suddenly start charging their weapons with clearly hostile intentions to stop you.

event.name: EVENT_3_CLONE_ON_SHIP
event.text: At the beacon near the active star you find a badly damaged piece of a ship of unknown origin. The crew on board most recently survived a terrible Mantis attack. Now the survivor ask you to save them, but the constant solar flares and debris flying around nearby can be dangerous.

choice.text: Dock to try and rescue the survivors.
Fire at this strange fragment of a ship.

event.text: You begin an attack. Scrap never hurts.
This strange ship doesn't look trustworthy. You decide not to risk it and charge up the FTL Drive instead.

You dock and successfully evacuate the crew and the surviving equipment. Solar flares during this time started a few fires on board. Also, you are surprised to note that all three evacuees are absolutely identical in appearance...

You dock and successfully evacuate the crew and the surviving equipment. Solar flares during this time started multiple fires on board! Also, you are surprised to note that all three evacuees are absolutely identical in appearance...

Your rescue operation failed miserably. All the evacuees vaporize into dust after a sudden solar flare... During this time a few fires start on board. Is it worth trying to scrap the equipment from this wreck of a ship?
You hang near the station for a while and grab everything that looks useful. The star continues to mercilessly burn your ship's hull.

textList.name: SLURM_FIGHT_RANDOM_TEXT
textList.text: There is nothing remarkable about this beacon, but a moment later you register an incoming FTL jump...
The beacon in front of you is empty. You don't have time to give any orders, because at that very moment another ship comes out of its jump...
Arriving at the beacon, you immediately register the incoming FTL jump of another ship...
Near the beacon there is nothing, but suddenly the space in front of your ship begins to bend and...

textList.name: SLURM_FR_TEXT_AUTO
textList.text: ...after a bright flash there's a Rebel drone at the beacon, and it isn't friendly!
...after a bright flash there's a Rebel drone at the beacon. After sending a short propaganda message, it attacks.
...after a bright flash there's a Rebel drone at the beacon. It hangs motionless for a while, and then, having noticed you, it attacks!
...after a bright flash there's a Rebel drone at the beacon. It identifies your ship as a "pest" and initiates an "extermination" program.

textList.name: SLURM_FR_TEXT_REBEL
textList.text: ...after a bright flash there's a Rebel ship at the beacon, and it isn't friendly!
...after a bright flash there are Rebels at the beacon. They are obviously surprised by your presence here, but nonetheless dare to attack.
...after a bright flash there's a Rebel ship at the beacon. After sending a signal for backup to the nearest beacons, it starts charging its weapons.
...after a bright flash there's a Rebel ship at the beacon. "We've finally caught up with you, you bastards!" They start charging their weapons.

textList.name: SLURM_FR_TEXT_JELLY
textList.text: ...after a bright flash there's a Slug ship at the beacon, and it isn't friendly!
...after a bright flash there's a Slug ship at the beacon. They accuse you of numerous thefts of their property and attack!
...after a bright flash there's a Slug ship at the beacon. They offer you scrap for your ship, and, having been refused, attack you.
...after a bright flash there's a Slug ship at the beacon. They try to hypnotize you, but that achieves nothing. Hissing some kind of curse, they attack.

textList.name: SLURM_FR_TEXT_MANTIS
textList.text: ...after a bright flash there's a Mantis ship at the beacon, and it isn't friendly!
...after a bright flash there's Mantis at the beacon. Seeing your ship, they happily scatter into combat positions!
...after a bright flash there's a Mantis ship at the beacon. The Mantis are extremely irritated at something, and your ship is great for taking their rage out on...
...after a bright flash there's a Mantis ship at the beacon, which immediately attacks you.

textList.name: SLURM_FR_TEXT_ROCK
textList.text: ...after a bright flash there's a Rock ship at the beacon, and it isn't friendly!
...after a bright flash there's a Rock ship at the beacon. On the communicator, you see a bulk of stone frowning their shaggy eyebrows and beating the panel with their fist! They attack.

...after a bright flash there's a Rock ship at the beacon. The Rockmen ask something about your religion, but your answer only makes them angry. They decide to conduct a ritual cleansing of your ship...
...after a bright flash there's a Rock ship at the beacon. "Just leave us alone!" — they say before they attack you. Looks like they confused you with someone else...

textList.name: SLURM_FR_TEXT_ENERGY
textList.text: ...after a bright flash there's a Zoltan ship at the beacon, and it isn't friendly!
...after a bright flash there's a Zoltan ship at the beacon. The Zoltans carefully scan your crew, and decide that it will be safer to destroy you.
...after a bright flash there's a Zoltan ship at the beacon. It looks like they mistook you for fugitives and are now attacking!
...after a bright flash there's a Zoltan ship at the beacon. You intercept part of their communications: "...a security threat. Possible declassification..." It seems that a battle is unavoidable.

textList.name: SLURM_FR_TEXT_PIRATE
textList.text: ...after a bright flash there's a pirate ship at the beacon, and it isn't friendly!
...after a bright flash there's a pirate ship at the beacon. Without further ado the pirates sit at your tail.
...after a bright flash there's a pirate ship at the beacon. After issuing an angry tirade to the Federation, they start charging weapons.
...after a bright flash there's a pirate ship at the beacon. "No offense, we just need your ship." After the short transmission they attack.

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_STORAGE_ALERT
event.text: You appear near a small planet. There are no ships nearby, but the scanners discover some structures on the surface.

choice.text: Go down and explore the buildings.
Charge the FTL Drive and fly away.

event.text: On the surface of the planet, you find a warehouse of Slig equipment. Although the warehouse doesn't look abandoned, there isn't anyone in it. You collect everything of value before giving the command to take off. At this point, an alarm is triggered, and you detect the transmission of an "INTERCEPT" command...
...the alarm doesn't stop...

...At last, the alarms stop and all is quiet, but you know you stirred up a hornet's nest. The Sligs will now clearly try to intercept you. The coordinates of the interception points are recorded on the map with the [Quest] markers.
On the surface of the planet, you find a warehouse of Slig equipment. Although the warehouse doesn't look abandoned, there isn't anyone in it. You collect everything of value before taking off.

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_STORAGE_PEREHVAT
event.text: The Slig ship at this beacon was alerted after your attempt to rob the warehouse's equipment. Get ready for a difficult battle!

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_STORAGE_PEREHVAT_2
event.text: The Slig ship at this beacon was alerted after your attempt to rob the warehouse's equipment. Get ready for a difficult battle!

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_STORAGE_PEREHVAT_3
event.text: The Slig ship at this beacon was alerted after your attempt to rob the warehouse's equipment. Get ready for a difficult battle!

event.name: BOX_AND_BOMB
event.text: A large container slowly drifts in the space in front of you. Explosives are plastered on all its sides, but it seems there's something valuable inside.
You place the container in the cargo hold and inspect it. The explosive mechanism uses 6 colored wires. Looks like if you cut one of them, it's possible to neutralize the bomb.
There's no one aboard your ship to cut a wire. You quickly throw the container back out the airlock and into space before it explodes.

After a detailed inspection of the bomb, it becomes clear how to defuse it. If there are no yellow wires, cut the third wire. If there is one yellow wire, cut the first one. If there's more than one yellow wire and no red wires, cut the last one. In other cases, cut the blue wire, and if there is no blue wire, then cut the black wire.
There's no one aboard your ship to defuse the bomb. You throw the container back out the airlock and into space before it explodes.
Now is not the time to take risks, your mission is too important.
There's no one aboard your ship to defuse the bomb. You throw the container back out the airlock and into space before it explodes.
Now is not the time to take risks, your mission is too important.
You were mistaken, and a monstrous explosion inside the ship tears apart one of your crewmembers.

removeCrew.text: The clone of the dead crewmember emerges from the Clone Bay.

event.text: You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You cut the correct wire, and the bomb is rendered harmless. After cautiously opening the container, you take its contents.
You see the following wires before you: 1 — red, 2 — black, 3 — white, 4 — red, 5 — white, 6 — blue. Cut which wire?
You see the following wires before you: 1 — yellow, 2 — black, 3 — white, 4 — red, 5 — blue, 6 — blue. Cut which wire?
You see the following wires before you: 1 — yellow, 2 — blue, 3 — red, 4 — white, 5 — black, 6 — yellow. Cut which wire?
You see the following wires before you: 1 — yellow, 2 — white, 3 — red, 4 — black, 5 — yellow, 6 — white. Cut which wire?
You see the following wires before you: 1 — black, 2 — black, 3 — yellow, 4 — yellow, 5 — blue, 6 — white. Cut which wire?
You see the following wires before you: 1 — white, 2 — yellow, 3 — yellow, 4 — red, 5 — blue, 6 — black. Cut which wire?

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_ESCORT
event.text: Near the beacon you meet a slightly damaged Slig ship. They ask you to escort them to local base.
You agree and the Sligs pay a small down payment for protection.
"Weak Sligs are the best prey!" — you decide and rush to attack...

choice.text: Decline; charge the FTL Drive and fly away.

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_ESCORT_POINT_GOOD
event.text: A group of Slig ships nearby thank you for escorting their comrade-in-arms and supply you with materials.

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_ESCORT_POINT_BAD
event.text: A Slig ship nearby attacks you, and the one that you accompanied sends a group of invading Sligs. It's a trap!

event.name: NEBULA_EVENT_SLURM_AUCTION
event.text: At a small station near this beacon, the Sligs are holding an auction...

choice.text: Charge the FTL Drive and fly away.

textList.name: EVENT_SLURM_AUCTION_LOSETEXT
textList.text: You pay your scrap, but one of the enterprising Sligs cuts off your bet...
You give your scrap, but, after some thought, the Slig next to you puts even more scrap on this product...
You place a bet, but a Slig in black glasses cuts you off...
You place a bet, but some Slig immediately makes one right after you...
Once you make a bet, a big Slig cuts you off with their bet...

event.text: ...today's lot is displayed on a large screen. You can get it right away, paying 200% of the cost, ortake your chances in the auction. A special rule in Slig auctions — the losing bets are not returned.
You take the goods for yourself.

choice.text: Participate in the auction. [Stake = 20% of the goods' market value. (14 ~)]

event.name: EVENT_SLURM_HALFMEBABY
event.text: Near the beacon is a Slig ship. They scan you for some time and then finally try to hail...

choice.text: Break off communications and attack them.

event.text: You rush to attack, intending to annihilate the Slig ship.

choice.text: Break off comm channels, charge the FTL Drive and fly away.

event.text: ..."We'll install a weaponsss sssysstem on your ship! Give uss sssome ssscrap and we'll do it quickly!"
You give the Slig the scrap, and they get to work.
..."We'll upgrade your weaponsss sssysstem! Give uss sssome ssscrap and we'll do it quickly!"
You give the Slig the scrap, and they get to work.
..."We'll fix your ship! Give uss sssome ssscrap and we'll do it quickly!"
You give the Slig the scrap, and they get to work.
Suddenly you notice that the weapons system power circuits are damaged, and the gang of Sligs ran back to their ship! Now their ship is attacking you!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and you notice that the weapons system has been upgraded!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and you notice that the weapons system has been upgraded!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and you notice that the weapons system has been upgraded!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and you notice that the weapons system has been upgraded!
Suddenly you notice that the reactor power circuits are damaged, and the gang of Sligs ran back to their ship! Now their ship is attacking you!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and you notice that you now have a weapons system!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and you notice that you now have a weapons system!

The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and the ship looks noticeably newer!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and the ship looks noticeably newer!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and the ship looks noticeably newer!
The Sligs quickly and efficiently perform their work, and the ship looks noticeably newer!
Suddenly you notice that the Sligs are attacking! To battle!

destroyed.text: It seems the battle is over...

deadCrew.text: It seems the battle is over...
